Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, having completed this book, the last of medical science, through its logical sequence it has reached its end, and considering its exposition, its explanations, and its declarations, I believe you have accomplished for yourselves this treatise, which is a part of the greatest operation, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, being the most complex and delicate of medical practices, it has been largely abandoned in our region and time, as its science is deemed dangerous and its methods outdated; only a few brief descriptions can be found in the books of the Ancients, which have led to errors and misconceptions regarding the understanding and application of its principles and art.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I have found it necessary to revive the order of this treatise through its second method of exposition and declaration and abridgment; and so that the forms of cautery tools and other surgical instruments be added to the declarations, and for the preparation of the patient, which is essential.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why our skillful physician does not always achieve good results in this our time is because the art of medicine is very complex, and requires that he be well-versed in the science of anatomy to understand the growth of the members and their forms, as well as their conjunction and separation; he must have knowledge of bones, nerves, and ligaments, know their names and how they are expressed; and of the pulsating and inactive veins, and the places where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for that reason, Hippocrates says that the name is appropriate, because in practice it is simple but more so in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for whoever is not acquainted with what we have said about anatomy, will be apt to fall into errors that may cause men's deaths, as you have seen many such cases where persons, though trained in this science, nonetheless fall into ignorance and misapprehension through lack of experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For you see a foolhardy doctor who has incurred a scrofulous abscess in the thigh of a woman, and incised some of her thigh's arteries so that great pus flowed until the woman died from it among her pains.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who prescribed a stone from a man who had been suffering in his state, and the stone was large, he came to him and extracted that stone with part of his bladder, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already called for haste to extract it, and you see that because of the size of the stone and the disposition of the illness, he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who was paid by a duke of our land to perform surgery, and he operated on a black crust that had a deep fracture in the thigh; because of the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture over the wound, with swabs and bandages with strong tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then, according to their desires, release the tension, rest, and after some days, command that we loosen the bandage; and thus it is also for the foot, which if not treated properly will lead to harm.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And you will have called upon him, and he will loosen the bandage, and achieved is peace, and thus also the alleviation of their pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	Yet if the corruption is already confirmed in the member, so that it cannot be restrained, and it does not cease to spread corruption throughout the member until the danger of the illness increases.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And he saw another doctor who perforates a cancerous abscess, and it becomes an ulcer after some days, until the evil of it grows great under his lordship.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the sharp pain is purely from melancholic humor; then it does not cover that it will come to him through all, but rather it should be in the member which suffers that it entirely overcomes.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation on the body be divided into two parts: one is the operation associated with health, and the other is the work which is perilous in the most important dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this in every place in this book where there are operations that contain error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to keep this and lay down that, so that the people do not take another path to speak and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with facility and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God, leading to salvation and glorious success, set aside the terrible illnesses that are difficult to heal, and abandon your weapons of fear, so that your faith and your name are not abandoned: for greater is what remains to your glory, both now and in eternity, behind you and after your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	They already cut open some of their own organs:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments poorly, so that bad doctors do not become notorious.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, starting with the first part of the first chapter.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered on the feet, in the forms of instruments and in the tools of cauterization, and about what is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incision and perforation, and also with suckers, plaies, the extraction of arrows and similar objects, all chapters and ordered according to the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and relocation, and on the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter ordered on the head within the foot, and on the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	With hot cautery and sharp medicine, and the remembrance of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of all the book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the heat from that cautery and the documents of it, and in what circumstances cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it is said that the discourse on the quality of cautery heat and the documents of it is a long and prolix topic, subtle for knowledge, and secrets hidden; and already many savants have spoken of it, and there are disagreements among them, and to me, a small part of their discourse suffices, lest it become too prolonged.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cauterization will benefit the entire universal connection, whether of material or its matter, except for two connections, which are connections with their own matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the connection that is dry and devoid of matter, it is said that cauterization is beneficial, while others claim the opposite, asserting that cauterization is not appropriate for illness caused by dryness and quality, since the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it would be counterproductive to treat a dry and secluded condition with a hot and dry remedy.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the opposite claim that cauterization is beneficial for all dry and secluded illnesses in the bodies of men, since when you compare the body of man with its humidity to the connection of fire, you find the body of man dry.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And they say through the discourse of that person, that they have already experienced this several times before in their discoveries.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone who has already been trained and practiced in the art of cautery on various parts of the body to come upon this suddenly. He should be familiar with the diversity of the structure of human bodies, the disposition of their maladies, the causes of those maladies, the circumstances surrounding them, and the passage of time regarding those conditions.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other circumstances, there is no cause for fear, especially in the case of painful and moist maladies, as all doctors are in agreement regarding these, and they do not disagree on the treatment with cautery in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it lie in cautery as a medicinal practice, for fire is simple; its action affects only the member being cauterized, without inflicting pain on other members nearby, but rather requires a slight pressure.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of the medicinal fire reaches those members from which it is withdrawn, and it strongly affects a member afflicted with a difficult-to-heal malady, aiding its recovery.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, for its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not cause harm but rather serves. It has long been known through experience and the longevity of studying the art based on the truth of causes; therefore, I excuse you from the length of my speech. If it were not that this secret fire is not read at my leisure in this brief pause, I would conceal nothing from you regarding its nature, its operation in the body, and its expulsion of maladies, demonstrated through philosophical discourse, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, my sons, that the best time to perform cauterization and make bandages is in the spring season.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the harm caused by time's accident is overcome by the healing power of cauterization, and most especially when cauterization is for pain or necessary pains, severe and acute, which do not suffer delay, lest those that come later be harmed, as it is better to avoid harm entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And so do not sit on your feet, my sons, for it is only the vulgar people and foolish doctors who believe that this illness, which is treated with cautery, does not fully heal, leaving a residual effect.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus as they believe, for cautery is but a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humors which are the cause of the pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet, one may use cautery superfluously over medicine due to the desire for its power, virtue, and greatness attributed to its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness returns at some point in time, depending on the nature of the illness and its location, and the power it holds within them, and what is prepared within their bodies from the addition of excesses and humors, and what has been acquired by them through food and similar causes; for the illness which receives cautery, if it is a subtle illness in a few excesses and humors, just as dental pain is treated with cautery, then it is possible that the same pain may not return to them, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is often said in popular speech that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is a very right saying, not to those who understand it, for they believe that it is not a cure that brings profit either by medicine or by any other cause with cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	But the reason is to the contrary; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when one applies the methods of healing in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and then at the end of the cause, one administers cautery and profites from it.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	From which it follows that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of the common people and too many foolish physicians.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not cause pain, which is not entirely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it does not do so unless in certain bodies; cauterization with fire from gold is good and better than what they said; nevertheless, when you make a cautery with fire, it is not clearly known, because the quantity of gold you use depends on the urgency of the situation, and if you apply it over the flame, the gold melts into the fire, and sometimes certain sheets fall into the fire for the craftsman to recover.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, cauterization with iron should be performed more gently and precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	You have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to other chapters, and you have ordered those within the feet first, so that later I am asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	On cauterization for head pain caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers dryness and coldness upon the affected part, which is one cause of sudden and multiple rheumatic flux, called rigor, from the head to the extremities of the limbs and ears, numerous times during sleep, as well as pain in teeth and the throat, and generally for any illness that arises from cold, also causing paralysis, stiffness, and apoplexy, and similar conditions in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization involves first commanding the malady to be evacuated using a laxative medicine for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command them to shave their head and place that scissors between your legs on a heated bench, and place their hands on their feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place your palm's edge near the root of the nose between their heels.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the pain in the middle of the foot has been overcome, mark that place with a try, and then heat the olive-shaped cautery from which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the healthy area marked with a try, in a descending manner, so that the patient's hand is gradually constrained, and you remove that.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then slowly lift your hand and examine the area; if you notice any bone uncovered, along with some amount of erysipelas (redness or swelling), raise your hand again, and if it doesn't return to that spot with the instrument (or another), as long as it is cold, until you can see the bone mentioned earlier.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt, dissolve it over the area, and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place your hand over the area soaked in border, leaving that one inside to destroy the wall of fire.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a four-ingredient remedy until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens, the better the limb gets, so it is better and more rejuvenated.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they said that some should have their joints cauterized within the bone, and hold the cautery until some part of the specific nature of the bone is dried up.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove what is attached to the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others said that with the cautery one can reach the rear, strengthening the bone completely until it hardens, and this is the way to achieve perfect healing:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place, vapours from the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And if the wound remains open for a long time, it should be treated until it is healed and consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not have the expertise to view these two types of cauterization instruments in all their variations, but according to certain sources, it is better for health when used appropriately; for when the head is exposed due to the solution of continuity within it, as we have witnessed in other members, and especially when the nature of the pain's head is fierce.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cauterization, which is primarily safer and better for me, should be used from this point onwards for these treatments to benefit health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	On the head cautery.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head and this prolongs the illness, and various remedies such as swords, spikes, scalpels, ointments, guaiac, dogwood, goat's hair, and similar things are used, and especially if a cautery has already been applied that does not address the root cause of the malady, one must consider whether the nature of the head disease is robust; and if there is no great contusion or significant injury, then apply another cautery instead of this one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that area on the side of the patient's head where the bone is fractured using an internal cautery.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the bone and expose the amount we have found and cauterize it with a cautery at the rear part of the head in the area known as the 'vas'—and that is the location where the vacuum is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And apply your hand to it, do not expose the bones, for this malady causes great and diverse pain compared to all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should perform this cauterization in its proper place, because you know that the cauterization with which the horns of the head and the occiput are cauterized is a more subtle cauterization than the one performed on the middle part of the head; and this is its form.
Capitol ters.	Capital chapters.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment of old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When a severe pain in the head or a sharp pain within the skull occurs, it is treated with medicinal capings, and other cures as I have mentioned regarding various ailments; if this does not provide relief, then cauterization on the affected area is performed in two ways: either with an acute medicinal fire or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	You may use cauterizing medicines or burning therapies, take a hot compress, cut open the affected area, and amputate its ends from both sides.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you should incise the site of pain in the temple with a sharp lance, until it is felt to be in the right place, leaving the thread untouched.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then you should bind it tightly with a compress for a descent contraction, leaving it for three hours; afterwards, remove the compress and place the affected area in cold water or ice for two to three days, and then apply a warm compress until the pain subsides.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you should treat it with a poultice until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you prefer, follow these burning medicines as described in the two treatises on burning medicines that I have written.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Apply the cauterization with iron according to this manner: ignite the cautery, whose shape is thus:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a claw clamp because its head has the shape of a claw with some curvature, and there is a small prominence in the middle part of it.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then apply pressure to the painful area, hold your hand—to prevent the wound from becoming infected—and slowly turn the iron at a gentle pace.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of blood stuck due to the specific nature of the wound is such that it equals or exceeds the capacity of the artery, raise your hand so that the artery is not compressed, preventing the flow of pus.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a compress with salt water over the area and leave it for three days; also apply a lot of moist heat until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, burn the tip of the knife with a cautery, and be careful not to cut an artery in this recent wound.
Capitol quart.	Capital quarter.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cauterization of ancient wounds.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat a wound as we have discussed in the previous section on cure and division of illnesses, but the treatment does not take effect, and the illness worsens, requiring a different approach than that of the initial cauterization with medicine or fire, then ignite the cuticular cautery until it becomes blanched. Place your hand over the area once more and press gently as you slice through the artery, aiming for the source of the pain.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is essential for you to prevent the jaw from moving excessively, as this impairs chewing. E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	And if it concerns the prevention and care of the flow of blood from an artery that is damaged, as damage to it is a cause for concern, especially for those who do not understand what it does and are not diligent or patient; then delay the operation on it until the beginning.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And now we come to the remembrance of the regulation of the flow of accidental blood from the artery according to their (doctors') manner, in their place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this illness does not allow for the application of a cautery and the body of the patient can tolerate it, then cauterize in the middle part of the head as we have mentioned above, and cure the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you find that the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter about the stretching of arteries with two edges is administered, this is a better and more effective cauterization.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of earache.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter .vi.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of tortuous (varicose) veins.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortuous veins that are cured and treated by cauterization are nothing but the species that come from flux, as we have said in the divisions of ailments.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that should be treated by drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias. E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery over the opposite side of the affected area, for mollification comes only from the part that appears to be healed.

And the method of cauterization is to apply the cautery to the base of the auricle, slightly above the corner of the forehead, and on the temple, its length corresponding to the length of the finger, and hold your hand over the cautery until the quantity of the substance of the skin is burnt.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of the cautery, and it is specially made from a knife, the shape of which is placed on the table.

E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And take care of the area that is exposed during the procedure until it heals.

Capitol .xiiii.	**Chapter XIII**
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	**On the Cauterization of Nose Putrefaction**
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat a patient with the method we have described in the previous section and your treatment does not benefit them, then prepare and give to the patient the following herbs to drink for three nights; then shave their head, and cauterize with a middle-sized olive cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply the cautery, using a claw-shaped cautery over both eyebrows, leaving the hair intact on one side.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the claw-shaped cautery is shaped like this.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or moisture, apply a cautery to that eyelid using a lunar-shaped cautery; and this is the shape of it:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply the cautery over both eyebrows with a small claw-shaped cautery across the entire area, and they should be elongated from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the amount of swelling.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	**Chapter XVI.**
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs change to scabs within and close up the wound.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs on the eyelid change to scabs within and close up the wound, cauterization is performed in two ways: either by making a cut or by using a medicinal burning substance.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If cauterization with fire is performed, instruct the patient to shave their hairs in such a way that they are neither too long nor too short; and if you need to, tie the eyelids shut with a bandage so that the hairs do not grow back until they have healed.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are born and engorged, place the patient's head on their left side, then apply pressure over the eyelid of their eye attempting to make a sign, a sign according to the shape of a dead leaf, and it should be the beginning of the sign near the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	Then apply a cold compress or a mucilaginous paste of plants over the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then apply the heat from the cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And apply the cautery over the marked figure, gradually and in small touches, until the surface of the skin, which is as if with a leaf of myrtle, is completely charred, apparently.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the healing of the eye is that you see the eyelid of the eye contracted and the hairs raised at the point of the eye's puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, then apply a poultice to the affected area until the pain is alleviated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns through the skin for any reason and the eyelid becomes soft, then make another cautery on that place exactly as you did originally.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hair is on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural place, sealed, and the hair does not smell bad.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is what you command the patient to do with the hair until they are prolonged and sealed, and then make a cloth in the shape of a fir leaf from the bandage.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take soap known and a sharp object, or what is suitable for this purpose, and mix those causes well, making it into a paste so that it is not frozen; and spread it over the cloth made thus in the form of a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both wounds; and wrap the wound edge soaked in albumen of egg, and the patient's head should be at a lower level.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then stop talking about the medicine and apply a small amount, not too much, until the patient feels the burning of the medicine, for burning is how it acts within them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, as you continue to observe this that the treatment is burning, stop the medicine and apply it again with caution; then, when the burning stops, wash the wound with water. And consider if the eyelid is lifted as it should be washed daily with either heat or incision, for that is what is appropriate now; and if it doesn't return to the application of this medicine at the place where the treatment wasn't effective, you risk compromising your operation and causing the wound to close up.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the affected area until the pain of the adhesion is eradicated, and apply a healing ointment or something else until it is cured.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you to perform your operation with careful vigilance so that no part of the medicine falls away, and if the eyelid becomes softened after several days due to any cause from the hairs in the eye, repeat your medicine on that area which has become softened from the eyelid, and indeed, just as you did at the beginning, and envelop it until it is cured.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the way of extracting the myrtle.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men differ in size and shape, and therefore your treatment must be adapted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let the path of treatment not be hidden from him who studies this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter .xvii.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have discussed regarding the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not help, then know that you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to sit with their head in a low position, and hold their head with a minister between their thighs in such a way that it is neither harmed nor agitated by their head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place some cloth soaked in alum or a paste of flower petals on the eye of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then shape the cautery as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which should be curved, similar to the shape of a cane or a serpent's tongue, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you see, they penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to get out this way, try it with caution.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	Yet he who is experienced is better at the medical work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is open, and try to clean and dry it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and remove the infection from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place over it a cautery that has been well-lit, and with your hand slightly lift the cautery from the part of the nose, so that your hand or the illness is not disturbed, and press the cautery on the gray parts of the nose and burn it.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of the burning with the cautery it penetrates into the bone, it is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, as needed; then leave that thus for three days, and apply your hand over that area with a dry compress until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it is not healed, then apply the sharp, corrosive medicine again until the bone is exposed and it heals as it should in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	There is another way to perform the fistula cautery that some masters speak of: enter the location of the fistula and close it; then apply your hand over the fissure gently, whose shape must be thus: pour a quantity of melted lead there; with your other hand, hold it firmly without harming the patient, so that the lead does not reach the wound of the illness. Cover the wound of the illness with cloth or water, as lead will adhere to the location of the fistula and heal it by a wonderful process.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cautery and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to apply a poultice and reduce the fistula to the nose inside according to its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	**Chapter XVIII**
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	**On the Cauterization of the Fistula**
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Frequently, accidents cause fissures on the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, when you treat those fissures with the methods we have discussed and your treatment does not take effect, make a small cut with a knife following this form...
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	and the cavity of it according to the thickness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place your hand carefully on those cracks so that the cautery reaches the depth of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that moist compress until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	**Chapter XIX**
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	**On the Cauterization of Fistulas in the Mouth**
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When, during the extraction of the uvula, or in the palate or around the teeth, there is an abscess that forms, and it breaks open, and becomes chronic, and a fistula is formed, and if you treat it but do not fully cure it, then you should ignite a cautery according to the size of the fistula. Place that burning cautery into the opening of the fistula, and with your hand, guide the burning point to reach the depth (of the fistula), doing this once or twice; and thereafter treat it with moist compresses as we have said regarding treatment, until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the wound is incised and cleansed, it is good; otherwise, it is necessary to expose the location and accommodate the corrupted bone as it will be discussed in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX:**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the treatment of teeth and the softening of arteries.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the arteries are softened by moisture and the teeth are loosened, and these conditions are not remedied with medicines alone, then place the patient's head on the knee, and shape the cautery so that when you place the flame over the tooth, it enters deeply enough for the patient to feel the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth, having been effectively removed.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeat the application of the cautery several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then make the patient gargle with salt water for an hour, after which he should spit it out, for the loosened tooth will be firmly set, the softened gums will tighten, and the corrupt moisture will be dried.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	On the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness, or there is swelling or pus in the tooth, and treatment with medicine does not bring relief, then a cautery should be performed in two ways: either with a cow's tail or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with cow's tail involves taking a strand of cow's hair and twisting it into a coil, then burning that in the fire, and afterwards, taking the hot end and wrapping it around the affected tooth, pressing down firmly until the pain is numbed by the cold.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, dip a cloth or twine in the wound on top of the tooth, and place that over the painful spot, and also place the heated iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of fire for cauterization is to address the inflammation or infection, and it should not be too severe or intense so as not to affect the opening of the hernia.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery as required, place it over the tooth and hold your hand over it until the cautery cools down; do this several times as the pain may return either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that the patient opens their mouth wide and holds the cautery for about an hour, then spit it out; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply the cautery as you have made extreme as it is within your ability.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of extrophules.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophules are caused by fluid and humors that do not obey digestion due to medicines, and you wish to remedy them slightly, then apply the cautery precisely according to its shape, having two pointed ends so that the fire of the cautery may reach both sides, and place the glowing end on the affected area once, and another if it needs more attention, until it reaches the point of the extrophule.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that medicinal ointment and bandages until it heals.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or pointed cautery for such use is conveyed.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On cauterization of wounds and constriction of vessels.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity appears on the surface of the lung, especially when it is chilled by external contact, then know that this illness must be evacuated at the beginning with medicinal laxatives, and then cauterize that place with a pointed instrument in the affected area.

E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then carefully tend to that as it is mentioned above until it heals.
Capitol .xxiiii.	**Chapter 23**
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	**On the Cauterization of Lung Sickness and Coughing**
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When coughing and lung sickness are caused by moisture, and the patient has no fever or phlegm, and it is an old illness, then cauterize as follows: make two incisions with cautery on the furcula (the bony structure in the base of the throat) at the spots that are vulnerable to infection; another cautery in the middle of the foot between the big toe and the next toe; and both cauteries should be done with a sharp claw, following the method mentioned above.
