De extraccio de ranula dejos la lengua.	Extracting the sac (ranula) with the tongue.
Alcunas veguadas accideys dejos la lengua apostema asemblant a nomla petita prohibent la lengua de la sua operacio natural; e fort leu es magnificada entro que huempla la boca.	In some cases, the tongue becomes inflamed and resembles a small, stiff lump, preventing its natural movement; it is greatly swollen and fills the mouth.
E la operacio en lu es que huebras la boca del malaute sesent devant le solel e considera le apostema.	And the procedure for it is that you open the patient's mouth wide, facing them towards the light, and examine the inflammation.
E si tu le vezes de fusca color o de negra, dur, al qual le malaute no atroba sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel quar es cranc.	And if you notice a dark, hard lump that the patient cannot feel due to numbness, then do not touch that area which is brittle.
E si es declinat a blancor, en le qual es humiditat, lahoras tu met le onci en lu, e inscideys aquel am spatum subtil, e inscindeys le de tota partida; e si sanc te ventz en la hora de la tua operacio, lahoras tu pausa desus zegi trissat, so es vetriol, entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	If it turns white and is moist, insert your fingernail into it, cut it with a fine spatula, and divide it entirely; if you have good ventilation during the time of your operation, place a zigzag veil over it, provided it constricts the flow of air.
E aprop retorna a la obra tua entro que lo haias trayt am compliment de lu, entro que sia lavat am vi agre e sal; e cura aquel am l’autra curacio ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then return to your work until you have completely treated it, after washing it with wine and salt; and tend to the other remedies for this until it is healed.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter .XXXVI.
De extraccio de apostema de doas aurelhas e de aquel que es nada en le golayro e de las autras apostemas.	On the extraction of the abscess from two ears and that which is in the throat, and other abscesses.
Quan endeveno en le golayro godat, so son glandulas las quals son asembladas algodat, las quals accideysso deforas e son nompnadas doas aurelhas, las quals quan tu las curas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no es sanat, lahoras tu considera si le apostema es dur, de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, lahoras no toques aquel am ferr.	When an inflammation in the throat occurs, there are glands that are gathered closely together, which protrude outside and are called "two ears," which, when you treat them with what has been said above, and they do not heal, consider whether the abscess is hard, of a dark color, and has little sensation; in this case, do not touch it with a knife.
E si es de roga color e la razic es grossa, lahoras no toques aquela am ferr per le flux del sanc; abantz layssa aquel entro sia madurat, e lahoras o tu trauqueras aquel, o sira romput per si.	If the disease is of a certain nature and the root is thick, do not cut it with a knife due to the flow of pus; instead, let it mature within, and either you will extract it or it will break off on its own.
E si es de blanqua color, radon, e la razit de lu es subtil, lahoras aquel es que cove esser inscidit.	And if it is of white color, hard, and the root is thin, then that must be carefully incised.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras, denant la tua operacio, si ja ha repausat le apostema de lu caut am repaus complit o si es deminuit am alcuna deminucio; e lahoras fay sezer le malaute denant le soleyl, e·l cap de lu sia en le tieu se, e huebre la boca de lu, e le servidor prenent entre las suas mas prema la lengua de lu dejos am instrument mot noble del qual aquesta es la forma:	And the operation on it is that you consider, in view of your operation, if the abscess has already rested and been healed completely or if it has decreased in size; then make an incision against the disease under the sun, with the head of the instrument in the lower part, opening its mouth, and a servant taking hold between his fingers of the patient's tongue with a delicate instrument of this form.
E sia fayt de argent o de aram, e sia subtil cum cotel.	It should be made of silver or brass, and the blade should be thin and sharp.
Donc cum tu premes am aquel la lengua e es mostrat a tu la apostema, e catz sobre aquel le tieu vezement, lahoras pren onci e fica aquel en l’amenla, e tira aquel a las partidas defora tant quant podes.	Therefore, when you press against that place with your tongue and the point is shown to you, then take a needle and stick it into that flesh, and draw it out of the body as much as possible.
Otra aquo que tiras alcuna causa de las tunicas, e aprop incideys aquela am instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another thing that removes some cause from the tunics, and then cut with an instrument whose shape is as follows:
e es asemblat a forceps, empero las extramitatz de lu son corvadas, ayssi que l’orrifici de quascuna de aquelas es en le endreyt del autra, mot agudas, le qual sia de ferr indi enbegut.	and is constructed like forceps, however the ends of it are curved, so that the point of each of those is in the opposite direction, very sharp, made of iron coated with steel.
Mays si aquest instrument no es a tu present, lahoras inscideys aquel am spatum del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: E sia agut de la una part, no agut del autra part.	If this instrument is not available to you, then cut with a spade whose shape is as follows: sharp on one side, blunt on the other side.
E pus que has inscidit una mella, inscideys l’autra segon aquesta meteyssa manieyra de inscizio, e aprop la inscizio le malaute guarguarise de aygua frega	And having cut a wound, cut the other in the same manner of incision, and then close the incision of the patient with hot water.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, guarguarise aygua de decoccio de scorsa de milgrana o de fuelha de mirtra e semblantz ad aquel de las causas stiptiquas entro que·l flux del sanc sia restreyt, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	If there is a flow of blood, rinse with a decoction of grain or myrtle leaves similar to the causes of the stoppage until the flow of blood ceases and then treat it so that it heals.
E alcunas veguadas naysso en le guolayro autras apostemas otra aquelas doas aurelhas, e inscideys aquelas segon que yeu e dit en la inscizio de doas mellas engualment.	And in some cases, there are other appendices or those two auricles, and you incise them as you have seen and said in the incision of two wounds equally.
E yeu ja fu medicat una femna de apostema le qual era nat en le golayro de lu, le qual apostema tendia a color fusca, de pauc sentiment, le qual ja havia claus le golayro de lu, e la femna respirava am meat streyt, e ja havia prohibit a lu comestio e beure de aygua, e ja era pervenguda a la mort si mays agues stat per un dia o per dos.	And you have already treated a woman for an abscess that was born in the groin of her, an abscess that tended to a dark color, with little sensation, which had already closed the groin of her, and the woman was breathing heavily, and she had forbidden herself from eating and drinking water, and she was on the brink of death if more time passed, even one or two days.
E l’apostema ja tant havia pugat que havia mezes dos ramps entro que eyssiro per dos traucs.	And the abscess had already punctured so much that it had created two openings through which pus would flow.
Donc yeu me cuytegui fisturalment e fiquegui en un de lor onci, e tiregui aquel, e atirada es de lu gran porcio, e aprop yeu incidigui aquela de on comprendegui del autre trau, e aprop yeu obrigui la boca de lu, e compremegui la sua lengua, e aprop yeu fiquegui le onci en aquela apostema.	Therefore, listen to me attentively and stay in one of their wounds, pull out that one, and the discharge from it is a great portion; then you should inspect where you understand the other injury is coming from, and then close the mouth of it, and grasp its tongue, and then leave the wound in that position.
E aprop yeu abscizi gran partida de lu, e no corria de lu sino un pauc de sanc.	And then you should cut out a large part of it, and there is not much discharge from it but some blood.
Donc absolut es le guolayro de aquela femna, e comensec tantost beure aygua, e aprop presec vianda, donc yeu no cessegui inscidir de aquela apostema motas vetz per lonc temps, e succesia apostema en loc de aquel, le qual inscizia entro que es prolonguat aquel.	Therefore, it is absolutely necessary for that woman; and soon after she begins to drink water, and take food, so you should not continue to incise those wounds again for a long time, but rather let each one heal in its place, which incision prolongs that condition.
Donc yeu engen agui e cauterizegui le guolayro de lu, donc astec de addicio; e aprop yeu perambulegui e no saubi que fec Dieus de aquela aprop mi.	Therefore, you should apply this and cauterize the wound of the patient, thus adding to it; and also walk around and do not clean what God has done for that patient.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter .xxxvii.
De inscizio de huvela quan es apostemada.	On the incision of the hernia when it is located.
Quan catarr deysen a la huvula, e es apostemada e es longa, lahoras ela es nompnada perpendicular; e si es en la partida dejos grossa e redonda, e lahoras ela es apelada buba.	When the catarrh is in the hernia, and it is located and long, then it is called perpendicular; and if it is on the side, thick and round, then it is called a bubo.
Mays quan es curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio, e no comfereys la tua curacio, e eyssament ja vezes que apostema caut ja es ostat de lu e es subtil, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquela que es agreguadas redonda; e si es ad aquela longitut, e es sanguina, de fusca color o de negre, e no es a lu centiment, lahoras cove que tu temtes la inscizio de lu, quar en aquela es temor sobre le malaute.	In cases where the treatment mentioned in the previous section is not effective, and the hernia has already formed into a hard mass, it is necessary to incise that which is round; but if it is of considerable length, and it bleeds, either dark red or black, and there is no sensation in it, then one must be cautious with the incision, for fear of aggravating the condition.
E quan tu vezes aquela segon la manieyra que yeu he dita de la sua blancor e longuesa, que tu fassas sezer le malaute e premas la lengua de lu am instrument del qual procesic la sua forma e aprop fica le onci en la nuva, e tira aquela en jos e inscideys aquela am un de dos instrumentz les quals e ditz en la inscizio de dos mellas.	And when you observe it according to the manner I have described regarding its whiteness and length, you must relieve the patient and press the hernia with an instrument that shapes it, then move it down and make an incision with one of two instruments used in the procedure known as the inscizio de dos mellas (incision of two wounds).
E cove que no inscidas aquela sino aquo que es ajustat sobre le terme natural ses addicio, quar si tu inscides de lu mays, lediyras le sieu parlar.	And be careful not to insert anything that is contrary to the natural order of its addition, for if you insert more than necessary, you will harm its function.
E aprop la inscizio, usa de aquo le qual havem recomtat en la inscizio de dos mellas, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	Then, make the incision, use what we have recommended for the incision of two wounds, and heal it so that it becomes healthy.
Mays si era le malaute espaventat per la inscizio de lu, cove que use de engen en la cauterizacio de lu ses temor, e la manieyra del cauteri en lu no es sino am aygua aguda, e es que tu pauses le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop prem la lengua de lu am le instrument le qual havem dit, e aprop pren de l’aygua la qual havem dita en le capitol de cauterizacio, e comfeys am aquela caus viva, e pausa aquela no spessa ni subtil, e de aquela omple la concavitat de l’estrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	If the patient was frightened by the incision, use cunning in the cauterization of it to calm their fear, and the manner of the cautery on it is nothing but sharp fire, and this is how you place the head of the patient on the table, and then press the tongue with the instrument we have mentioned, and take water as we said in the chapter on cauterization, and apply that as a living force, and do not make it too thick or too thin, and fill the concavity of the instrument whose form this is:
Sia la extramitat de lu conquavitat en la qual sia pausada la medicina ayssi cum la conquavitat de culher de ray, e pausa le strument am la medicina sobre la vula, e·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu latz per so que corro saliva o musellage de la boca de aquel per la intrinscequa medicina, per so que no deyssenda de aquela deguna causa sobre le golayro de lu e que ledesca aquel.	Let the end of it be concave in which the medicine is placed, just like the concave part of a spoon, and place the instrument with the medicine on the wound, and have the patient lie on their side so that saliva or mucus from their mouth does not fall due to the inherent nature of the medicine, so as not to cause any harm to their throat.
E aprop te la tua ma am la medicina, e exprem aquela sobre la uvula per l’espazi de miega hora entro que vegas aquela esser denegrada e sedada per la mordicacio de la medicina.	And then apply your hand to the medicine, and extract it from the throat by making space for a while until it becomes weakened and numbed by the bite of the medicine.
E si vols, prengues coto e envolopes aquel sobre la extremitat del ray, e submergeys le coto en la medicina, e entrometas le ray am le coto en una canula de sobre entro que·l coto adheresca en aquela canula, e fay aquo tantas vetz entro que consiegues aquo que vols de la cauterizacio de la uva, e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela se seccara e cayra aprop tres dias o quatre.	And if you wish, take care and wrap that around the end of the ray, immerse the wrap in the medicine, insert the ray into the wrap in a pipe-like manner until the wrap adheres to the pipe, and do this as many times as necessary so that you achieve what you want from the cauterization of the ulcer, then let it dry so that it falls off after three or four days.
E si indigeysses que iteras la medicina, itera aquela, e aprop la cauterizacio abstergeys en le circuit de la uva am coto enbegut en boder, e mondifica am aquel aquo que es en le circuit de lu de la medicina, e sia lavat am aygua frega, e sia curat deforo am embrocacio, e dedintz am guarguarismes entro que sia sanat.	And if you need to repeat the medicine, repeat it, and then remove the cauterization from the ulcer with a cloth soaked in the medicine, clean that which is in the patient's wound with the same medicine, wash it with warm water, apply external remedies, and use internal treatments until it heals.
E aquesta especia de curacio es pus salva que inscizio e pus long de temor.	And this specific type of treatment is much safer than incision and free from fear.
Alcunas veguadas es curada la uvuola am aquo que es pus subtil que cauteri e inscizio, quar es curat am subfumigacio en aquesta manieyra: recipe calament, ysop, origua, ruda, scicados arabic, camamilla, broyda e semblant ad aquels de las erbas, e ajusta totas aquelas causas, o alcunas de lor, en una ola, e sian submergidas am vi agre, e bulhan; e la ola sia be lutada am lut decentment, e sia en le mieg loc de la ola un trauc, sobre le qual sia pausat un instrument conquau de aram segon aquesta manieyra; sia fayt de argent o de aram.	Sometimes the ulcer is cured with something more subtle than cautery or incision, and this is done through sublimation in this manner: take calament, hyssop, origan, rue, scorzonera, chamomile, broad (possibly a type of herb), and similar ones from among the herbs, and address all those causes, or some of them, in a single mixture, and let them be submerged in wine and boiled; and the wave should be beaten decently with a wooden instrument according to this manner; it should be made of silver or bronze.
E sia entromesa la extremitat en la boca del malaute entro que la vapor poge a la uvula sobre la quanula, entro que la uvula sia mot ofuscada.	And then the extremity should be inserted into the patient's mouth until the vapor reaches the ulcer and covers it, so that the ulcer becomes completely obscured.
E aprop itera sobre aquela motas veguadas entro qu’es secca, e guarda te que no fassas aquesta curacio al comesament de l’aveniment de apostemas, quar trop ajustaria en le apostema, e no cove que tu fassas aquo, sino deves la declaracio de apostema de lu caut.	Then repeat this process for any remaining spots that appear dry, but be careful not to perform this treatment during the acute phase of the disease, as it might over-irritate the affected area and you should only proceed if you have properly diagnosed the hernia (apostema) through cautery.
Mays si no es a tu present aquest instrument, lahoras pren una cana e compon en la extramitat de lu un clos de huou, per so que la boca del malaute sia comborida, quar le closc del huou prohibeys la vapor comburir la boca.	If you do not have this instrument at hand, take a cane and, at the end of it, make a hook with wire, so that the mouth of the hernia is closed, because the hook of the wire prevents the internal gas from burning the mouth.
E aquesta curacio es bona am salut.	And this treatment is good for health.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter XXXVIII.
De extraccio d’espinas e de aquo que adhereys en le golayro e de las autras causas.	On the removal of splinters and substances adhering to the skin, and other causes.
Motas veguadas adhereys en le guolayro o spina de peys o alcuna autra causa.	You may observe substances adhering to the skin or splinters of nails or any other cause.
Adonc cove que tu extraguas aquo que de aquels es apparent, sobre le qual catz la vista, pus que tu premes la lengua am instrument denant solelh, per so que a tu sia declarat aquo que es en la guola.	Then, you should extract what is apparent from these, examining it with the eye, after having pressed your tongue against the instrument, in order that you may clearly see what is in the mouth.
E aquo que no apar e es a tu occultat en le guolayro, cove que tu fassas vomir le malaute denant que la vianda sia degerida en l’estomac, quar fort leu la causa annexsa le golayro sira foro-getada per vomit; o que deglusia le malaute una pessa de nap o de razit de laytuga o un boci de pa sec; o prengua una pessa de sponga marina sequa leon, e lia aquela fortment am fiel, e aprop le malaute transglussia aquela, quar cum perve al loc en le qual so spinas e es extrahuda, lahoras so foro-getatz.	And if something appears hidden in the stomach and is beyond your knowledge, make the patient vomit before the food is digested in the stomach, because the powerful cause attached to the stomach will be forgotten through vomiting; or let the patient swallow some piece of nap or finely chopped lettuce or a bite of dry bread; or take a piece of dried seaweed, twist it tightly with a needle, and make the patient swallow it, for when it reaches the place where there are spines and it is extracted, then it will be forgotten.
E mays pren una anguila e be am fiel liada, e sia dedintz mesa e soptament sia extrayta; o pren un porr e soptament le metas e soptament l’en tratz.	You may take a snake and twist it with a needle, place it on the table and extract it carefully; or take a reed and carefully pull out its inner core.
Mays si no so foro-getatz am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas, lahoras husa de un instrument de plom segon aquesta forma:	If these causes are not forgotten, then use an iron instrument in the following manner:
E sia pus gros que ray un petit, e en la extramitat de lu sia conquavitat la qual tu entrometas en la sua guola am facilitat.	And make it a thick wire with a thin point, and at the end of it, there should be a concave part that you insert into his mouth easily.
E el aga le sieu cap elevat en sus, e guarda te que·l tocament del sieu os de la gola, per so que endevengua a lu cos e am aquela que enpellesca le os o la spina, o que aquel le metge am la sua ma.	And he raises his head up and be careful of the touch of his bone in the throat, so that he understands what causes him pain, whether it is from a bone or a spine, or how that doctor places his hand on him.
Mays empero que·l malaute aquel entrometa es miels, per la sua sciencia del loc de la causa annexa e enpellisca en jos, e tira la sua ma am le instrument en sus, tot aquo segon la quantitat la qual es a lu preparada entro que sia foro-getada.	However, if that patient has more pain, it is better because of his knowledge of the place where the cause resides and he pushes it down and pulls his hand with the instrument towards him, all according to the amount prepared for him until it is forgotten.
Capitol .xxxix.	**Chapter XXXIX.**
De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the extraction of blood from the throat.
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When treating phlegm as we have discussed in the division of treatment with medicines and it does not correspond, consider the throat of the patient at sunset, since you will have to use an instrument to extract his tongue, which you have recommended.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you examine the blood flow, extract that small or subtle swelling decently.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	If it is not possible to extract the swelling, take a concave needle and insert it into the wound of the patient, then place over the concavity of the needle a hot iron, and do this several times (as long as the blood flow stops and the swelling is removed from the wound) and keep the patient on water for the rest of the day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	Then take a vessel filled with water, apply its mouth to the wound, and wash the wound with it; do not spill any of that water and change it every hour or so, as the blood will soon absorb the water.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	If we have not forgotten what we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with spices or asafoetida using the instruments we have prescribed for the suffumigation of the throat.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do this, so it falls in the right place.
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	And another way of operation through suffocation of that is that you take a cloth in which are ignited coals and the cloth is covered with a cover in the middle of which there is an opening, and it is on that opening that the tip of the instrument is placed; then apply suffocation from above; and the patient should hold his mouth at the end of the tube, and close his mouth so that the suffocation is not blown away until you know that the suffocation has reached the blood flow, for the blood flow will fall shortly.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if he does not eat, then you repeat the suffocation with motes again, and prevent the patient from drinking, and eating salty and cold foods, and do not let him drink water, and so it is necessary that at this regimen he should abstain.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the form of the instrument used to extract blood from the body when it is seen; and it is similar to forceps also, but with some curvature:
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	Which is placed over the gullet, and its end resembles a spoon beak, which is called a quile, that is sharpened with lime, for this reason, when we encounter any cause, it does not leave.
Capitol .xl.	**Chapter XL.**
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which the whole of the discourse is concerned with the perception of apoplexies and their section.
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Apoplexies are special motifs, with various manners of occurrence, according to the recollection of their memories, each one in this book.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their piercing and section in two ways: one is for the specific type of apoplexies themselves; and by what we understand about humidity.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second manner is the locations in which bodily accidents occur, where an apoplexy occurring in the head is different from one occurring in the buttocks; and an apoplexy occurring in the fleshy part is different from one occurring in a joint; and each of them has its own treatment through operation.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And some pustules are such that they do not need to be pierced, but rather serve as a maturation of the health in those or their completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Other pustules that need to be drained when they form crosses and are not mature according to their size, also include those that occur near joints, where a pustule forms close to a joint, the condition of it persists as long as you can see it in the circulatory system of the body, and it strongly corrupts the ligaments or nerves of that joint, leading to the contraction of that member; or it is a pustule near a major limb, and if you delay piercing it until it has matured, it will affect the main limb; or it is near the buttocks, so you should pierce the one that has not matured; and do not drain the crusty one, unless it is one forming near the anus, where you cannot drain it from the inside, but rather it elongates into the anal fissures within the buttocks, and a fistula forms or some other condition in its place.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	You also know the time to drain the pustule, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And you will know that recovery has begun when the pain ceases and the fever abates, and there is a reduction in rigidity and pulse, and the redness of the affected area becomes less pronounced, as well as other symptoms.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And furthermore, know how to recognize when the incision should be made in the location of the abscess and when pus is present as a result of healing of the swelling.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	The incision should always be made through the skin or flesh, if the abscesses are in the thighs or feet, and in places where there is no reflection; for in those that do reflect, the incision should be made according to the member affected.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the abscess is in a fleshy location, it is better to wait until the digestion of the pus is confirmed as per our previous discussion; for if you make an incision there before, it prolongs the course of the disease and intensifies the pain and swelling around it, making it deeper.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	You may make some incisions through the thickness of the flesh or body part as required, or according to what the member needs.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And be aware that you should make small incisions, and in large appointments, a great perforation and wide sections according to the diversity of the size of the appointments.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And others are of appointments where it is necessary that the skin be turned in and cut, when thus done as if bread and made is in a term that already exists, so as those that occur in cases of doubt and abscesses.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised in a section with three angles; and of those where it is incised thus like the figure of a myrtle leaf, so as the appointments of the ankles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of their kind where a round section and lunar section is administered, and similar to those.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	If that one has no such problem when the surface wounds are minor, then you should make a shallow or flat incision only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the wound is deep and has already collected a lot of pus, you should make an incision and do not be concerned about extracting all the pus at once; after removing a portion, wait until the next day and then remove another piece, increasing the size gradually according to the degree of healing.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is a frail individual, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an elderly person, since the animal spirit moves quickly towards healing, and strongly resists the removal of the wound, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Pay close attention to this chapter, and be careful with the incision you make for these wounds; clean the infections and consider whether the wound of the apostema is small or a flat incision, then administer the appropriate treatments; if the apostema is large and the openings of the incision are deep, then apply pressure on each opening until they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess a portion of the cord or its concavity is separated, then cover it with thick cloth or thread made from linen, just as you would bandage a cut or wound; tighten it on the third day and treat and heal the inflammation from infections until it is cured.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	If a flow of blood occurs during your operation, then administer clean water and vinegar mixed together, place a cloth made from linen over the area where the bleeding is happening, and apply pressure.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	If the bleeding persists, then you must administer remedies and treatments, and apply powders recommended at various locations of this book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	If it is during winter, and the location of the abscess is in a place with many nerves, then you must soak swabs in hot oil and vinegar, and apply them to the affected areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the parts are fleshy, then you should apply cool poultices soaked in water and oil or wine and oil, and all of this should be changed every third day, as we have said, and you should loosen the crust and clean that part and administer what is appropriate for its healing until it is cured.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the treatment of all types of hernias generally, but more according to the method of distinction that I have already mentioned about each type of hernia and its specific way of treatment.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xl.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	On the section of hernias that occur in the neck region of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck region of the head are small hernias, which are of various types with membranes that contain them; and these types are distinguished by their names.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from their glands flow drops, and those contain a moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And those that contain moisture similar to sweat, and those that resemble them; and those that are stone-like, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the removal of all, and in the extraction of those, there is no fear, as the incision of those does not cause painful resistance.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in incision of those is that you expect those to be in the form of instruments, which are called entromes, as you know that they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	For if what contains is moisture, then you cut those as you separate them according to their length by making a superficial incision in this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And it begins at the section of the line B within the line G. Therefore, when the humidity is evacuated, you scrape that which contains that humidity, and do not leave any cause for it, as troops seen returning may indicate some other cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then immerse the affected area in Egyptian nettle, if present, or in water and salt; fill it with that plague and leave it for another day, as it corrodes everything that breaks through that crust.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then you repeat the application of Egyptian nettle to that area according to need, as long as you are confident that there is no other cause behind that crust; cure the plague with nettle until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if there is an abscess with fatty nodes, then you cut into it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	I have a section without the form of a cross, and cut between the two lips of this section and tear it apart from every side, and use your virtue to extract the tunic which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	If it causes you discomfort, do what I have first told you.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, perform in the abscess of the section and treatment as I have told you; and cut over the abscess that is lighter, because it is less painful and has little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And sometimes there are certain abscesses of these which are in the head on some men who have no humidity at all; which causes because you must incise an abscess on the head of an old woman and drain the abscess thus with a hard, blunt, white stone that cannot be chewed, and if anyone were to touch it, they would be infected.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	In other instances of accidental apoplexy in the head, different from this chapter, there are such apoplexies that come upon the children's heads and require the removal of the auricles, but the section concerning all these should be a superficial one.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And stop the perforation of those in the lower part of their division so that the matter of the wound is removed from the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	Then tend to those affected by it as is appropriate for healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	On the section of scrofula that occurs in the collarbone.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Uncommon instances of these apoplexies occur in the collarbone, armpits, and angles, and sometimes they occur in other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And so those that occur in the colon, and so movements that are generated within them, and all scrofula of those comes from their own tunic, and thus as with the nodes and abscesses of the head, so we have treated.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of these scrofula are movements, some of which are stone-like, and others contain moisture, and some are malicious that do not obey treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that case where you perceive good disposition in the touch, of which the color of what is manifest is proper to the color of the ulcer, and it is degraded throughout, and not attached to the colon's nerves, veins, or arterioles, and it is neither full nor swollen, you must incise it at the dry superficial part of the ulcer from its position within the body, to the position beyond the body, along the line of G. within the line of B., and remove it from all parts, and cut away the edges of the ulcer with a knife if necessary, as we have said regarding abscesses in the head, and extract that little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve is not incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And if the knife is not sharp, or does not fit in your hand for incision, or causes anxiety to the patient, and you make an unnecessary incision on a vein or nerve, then it hinders your operation; the abscess will fester with vinegar or other powders that prevent pus from flowing out, and it will cause pain and leave a scar until the inflammation of the abscess subsides and the infection begins to heal.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the pus is drained.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until it is completed.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then carefully inspect the small scrofulous nodules; if any show signs of infection, make an incision and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is at the root of a large scrofula, you must be careful not to incise that scrofula from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Furthermore, be careful not to cut that thin, folded string too short, as it might slip and cause harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with warm, thin wool that you have already soaked in Egyptian ointment, and treat it accordingly.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you completely cut out the scrofula, be careful to close both sides of the wound tightly so that no excessive pus forms.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	If you notice that there is excessive pus due to the size of the scrofula, be careful to understand where to cut, remove it, and then stitch it up and apply what is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of scrofula that contain moisture, pierce them with a superficial piercing at the place where you see the maturation of it, and stop the piercing of what is the base of pus in the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer the piercing, you should find and similar things to these, so that it corrodes what is broken down by corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the plague already cleansed, you should cure it with the ointment of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	On the section of the pilot (or membrane) of the abscess, make an incision.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients said that this incision on the pilot (or membrane) was effective, and they have not seen any other thing like it done in their land.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the speech of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	In some men there is a deficiency, so the extraction of the stone should be avoided, for by doing so prematurely, all the veins and the major ones related to the illness are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	In those who have sores in the mouth or throat or both ears, when the illness is not in the gums, it is necessary to avoid the extraction of stones to prevent the loss which is caused by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want to do this, the stone should be incised below three circles of the stone's circles, or four with a small section in the space between two circles for its quantity, that the incision is in depth, not in the cartilage, and this place is suitable for an incision because it is devoid of flesh and the blood vessels of the stone are open.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the doctor is cautious, you must ensure that he extends the cord of the gauze slowly, and then cuts the cord until it reaches the canal, but avoid the vessels of blood if you encounter any cause to do so.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then, we insert the scalpel as recommended; it is meant to section the canal for the flux that is situated here, which is due to something broken and detached from its place, and through the removal of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour arrives for the closure when the opening is feared, add two layers of the gauze cord to the wound, and use one alone for the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that promote the healing of the flesh until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the essence of our discourse, which we have collected, is to observe that some of these apopthems have already compressed the gullet of the patient, and the malady has entered into the body, and the air of it has been cut off, and some wish to incision the epiglottis so that the malady breathes over the place of the wound through some respiration, and thus be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this, I will order the wound to remain open until the evil of the malady is consumed; and the evil lasts for three days; so now I will order the treatment of the wound, and its cure, until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have seen myself, is that a servant used a sharp object and cut into the throat of the patient, and also made an incision on one part of the lung, and I was called to treat it; and I observed the death rattle as if from a dying person, and discovered the wound, and found the inflammation which had come from the wound's infection.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore you shall confess that you have neither cut a vein nor guided the flux, and the air still comes from the plague, and you treated it until the fire of sickness was cured.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And do not press the servant unless it is necessary in your voice, and after some days return to the improvement of their dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that in the section of the epiglot there is no fear.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter .XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the section about an abscess that occurs outside the stomach, which is called a stomach hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess, called stomach hernia, is a great abscess according to the color of the body, and it occurs more in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is divided into two manners, either natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural, it is not subject to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental is divided into two manners: one is similar to gouty nodules, and the other manner is akin to apoplexy caused by the blockage of an artery, which is fearful.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not make a diagnosis with certainty except for the patient who seeks help.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And you should examine the patient and if it appears similar to gouty nodules, and there is no obstruction in any of the veins, then you puncture them thusly with a needle, and extract that which contains the pus from the abscess; otherwise, you should scrutinize the entire body and appropriately treat the area requiring cure until it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .xlv.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	On the section of the removal of nodules.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	The nodules have various shapes and sizes, and as I have already described all the types of their divisions.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is important to distinguish between a nodule and an excrescence, with careful consideration.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, one says that an excrescence is a hot condition and fever with violent pains, until the ebullition of the excess subsides; and it is putrefaction that stops the fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	A nodule is not hot nor febrile nor painful, but it is like a lion that has been taken from its den and brought to light.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And according to the color of the body, its beginning is like a cease and is done thus with vacuum, either greater or lesser, and they are according to two species, as if they were fat and contained humidity, and the colors of the humidity are spots, as I have said in division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you reach the treatment of a node, you must expel that and inquire about the beginning of the disturbance which is called an "intromis", according to how it takes its form in the chapter most appropriate to this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the manner of inquiring into abscesses and all nodes; you take this disturbance and insert that into the place most humid which you find in the abscess, and you will turn your fingers around there bit by bit until you know that this disturbance has already penetrated the wall.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then you close your hand according to the measure of the abscess's size, and you extract the disturbance, and consider what has remained in the trace of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the current humidity is forgotten, of whatever color it may be, you insert a scalpel into the superficial section as I have said in the other posts.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no humidity left from the intrusion, then you know it is grave.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And dry it with a section having the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	Thus taught, lift it up, and extract the stone from every part with ease, and inspect the pouch or sac if possible over that, and draw out that health from the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	If it is broken during the operation, it is not possible to extract that health, and you should repeat this process until it is successfully extracted from within without causing any further damage.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	If from the lung arises any cause, either little or much, the nodule returns according to its nature.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you notice that from the lung any small part is affected, complete the plague with some sharp corrosive powders and strengthen the plague, and apply a hot poultice to the one that is infected, and cure the other with appropriate treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is not large, then you cut both lips of the lung and cure it with this that incrusts.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	If the vein is pulsatile or not, you cut and apply the place of a trissate seal that is vitriol and let that strangle for two days or three until the plague subsides and the inflammation of the sanc ceases; then return to incise what is broken from the node.

De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the care of the breasts of men, which are assembled from women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Some incisions are inflated in the breasts of certain men due to the pressure of sleep when they begin to be hairy, and then the breasts are inflated, and the breasts of women are assembled, and they remain apart, distant.

And for those who wish to treat this, they should incise those sections of the moon according to this form, from the line B to the line G, and then remove all the grossness, and fill the wound with incarnate medicine, and adjust both lips of the wound with stitching, and heal what is within so that it becomes healthy.

If a nipple retracts from its attachment and becomes softened due to its magnitude, as is often the case with women, then it should be cut in two parts, its pus drained, and each portion shaped like a crescent moon; each should contain the end of the other, so that the longer line contains the shorter according to this form of the line B and G. Then excise the cord connected between the two lips of the wound, stop the discharge, and administer what has been mentioned regarding sutures and powders, as necessary for healing until it is cured.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not perform the incision as required due to the restlessness of the patient and the flow of pus, then fill the wound with a corrosive ointment and leave it until it corrodes the hardened matter, and then cure it until it is healed.

De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	About the perforation of abscesses that come from beneath the skin.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that come from beneath the skin are caused by the species of scrofula, hard ones, which contain a pus that needs to be drained.

Capitol .xlix.	**Chapter XLIX**
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the section of abscesses that occur through archery or vein injuries.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an arrow breaks and the string (or cord) is tightened that is above it, then abscesses are seen to occur, and the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are due to an artery or vein: for when an abscess is from an arrow, a long accumulation occurs in the preceding part of the body; and when you press the abscess, you feel a ringing sensation within.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that which is from a vein turns into the general manifestation of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And the section regarding this abscess is incorrect, especially in those that leave openings, and in the angles, and in the collarbone, and in most parts of the body; and since it is so large, it is necessary to avoid its treatment with iron, and for those in the extremities, or at the head, it should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	Place a linen over the affected area due to inflammation from archery wounds, cut it in the middle of the thigh; then incise the section with scissors and expose the wound, removing the arrows and tunic until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	Then take a needle and make it penetrate through the other layer, opening the wound at two points—which causes the patient to experience pain due to the removal of two arrows lodged in the thighs.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	Then apply pressure to the area between the two ligaments using a spatula until the swelling subsides and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	Then administer treatment to the area where pus has formed until the ligaments fall off, and care for it with suitable ointments until it heals.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	If the abscess is due to vein section, then you must cover your hand over it as much as possible near the abscess in the thigh, and insert the needle into the area where you have placed your hand, making it penetrate; then pull out the foreign body from the other side while maintaining the thread double, and bind the abscess with suitable ligature according to what I have said earlier regarding the grapevine ligature on both sides of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	If you fear that the thread might break, insert the needle into the remaining aperture, following the path of the first incision, and tighten your threads at four points.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Next, dry the aperture in the middle part of it; when the swelling has subsided, make an incision into the excess of the cord and leave what is attached to it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place a poultice on it, which you have soaked in vinegar and oil, and apply the treatment that is done with heat and cold until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	To complete the treatment of the hernia that occurs due to nerve strain.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Thus, hernias occur in the rear and venous regions; they also seem to occur in the nerves when they are struck or due to excessive labor, or in a similar manner.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is applied to the most painful areas of the legs or feet, or anywhere the joints are troubled.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	It is a severe apoplexy, resembling the color of another body, and it affects its largest parts; when squeezed by violent force, a sense of stupor seems to envelop the patient.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	It is not an apoplexy affecting the whole body, and therefore the patient remains conscious; it is felt throughout the entire body and does not affect any specific parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, regarding those who have it in the joints, it does not indicate that it is caused by iron; for as their pain increases, contraction will ensue.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	The person who has it in the head or forehead should bind the neck with a bandage.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	If it is a minor abscess, then cut around it and remove that part.

Capitol .lii.	Chapter II.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	On the cure of hernia (or 'eminence' of the navel).
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The hernia or protrusion of the navel is caused by various reasons: either through fissures in the abdominal wall above the belly, and the intestine or hernia returns to its cavity as it should in other ruptures; or through a vein or an artery that flows from it (as described above), or due to excessive flatulence confined within.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	If it is due to an abdominal wall fissure and the hernia's protrusion, then the color of the hernia will be similar to that of the body; it will be painful, and its position will vary.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is for the removal of the hernia, consider the position of that which we have recounted with greater diversity, and when you press on those ties, it is as if they are concealed, then return; it is firmly attached to its own place, and it magnifies the need for much bathing and vigorous work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	If it is due to humidity, it becomes hard and is not concealed when you press with your hand, nor is it constricted or ruptured.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is due to scrofula, then these symptoms appear as an abscess turning black and declining.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	If it is not due to flesh, then the abscess is severe, thick, and hard, and it is fixed according to its quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	If it is due to windiness, then the touch of it is hard.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation on it is that you consider when the prominence of the navel is due to a hernia, or a vein, or from flatulence; then know that you should refrain from treating it, for there is fear and danger as it is taught in the chapter where I have spoken about hernias by arteria and vena.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	If the prominence of the navel is due to an intestine or hernia, then know that you should order the patient to take a few deep breaths and lie down; then gently press around the entire navel, and command them to keep it reversed between your hands on their back, and wrap a broad spatula around the navel in the area where you felt the pressure; and extend the amount of the hernia upwards towards the thighs with gentle force; and then secure the opening with a strong thread or catgut in a proper manner.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	Then open the hernia by cutting through the ligament and insert your finger into that opening to explore the intestine; and if you have tightened or tied it up with the ligament, then carefully cut it free and gently push the intestine back inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the infection, then take some ointment; and cut away its excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	If it is contrary to your skill or vein, then circle that part, and return to your operation; and take two needles and insert them into those two strong threads and pass two needles through the loop which you have made around the abscess in a crosswise manner, which will make them penetrate; and then tighten the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat. And if the prominence of the navel is only flesh or due to moisture, then cover as you have done with the abscess, thus removing the sanch or moisture which you find in it, and then care for it with something that covers and strengthens the area.

Then prepare the hernia for the operation with a preparation in which it is located, and cauterize the incisions that cover it; and carefully explore all parts with the knife to avoid any cause for concern regarding the roots of the hernia.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments. Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already discussed, in the previous section, the types of hydrophobia and the signs of each type, as well as the medicinal treatments for them.

And at the upper end of it is a ring, for when the instrument reaches the water, this will immediately seize upon the instrument, thereby evacuating a large quantity of water in the meantime, for if you evacuate less than necessary during that time, strong pain may result from the resolution of their animal spirit or death may occur.

Capitol .lvi.	Chapter LVI.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of the alba (a term related to the foreskin) that occurs in the prepuce at the head of the penis due to decay and corruption, and the blackness and adhesiveness of the prepuce at the head of the penis.
