And when the fistula is penetrating into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then the meaning of it is the emission of urine from that area and its prohibition from being used for treatment until the location is medically consolidated.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	If it is penetrating into the joint of the thigh or into the bone and causes pain in the surrounding area, then its sign is that tension prevails here if there is no stiffness within the bone, and pain in the radiating parts; and it festers forever; and it does not respond to treatment, nor is it consolidated with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure, and the cure for them lies in the diligent and thoughtful work of skilled physicians over which they remain firm.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	However, in cases that are not penetrating or recent, healing with ferric substances is hoped for according to what you have been advised and what has already been tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And indeed, the patient's affliction is between your legs over their intestines, the legs are raised within them, the parts are inclined towards the patient's abdomen, and then you insert a plug of lead, or iron if it is in a narrow fistula, at the place where you know the tent enters.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if that feels like the affliction is around the heart, then you must insert your small finger vertically into the chest.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel in the small finger a sensation as if it were already discovered and the attempt to penetrate is complete, or if you feel something between the thumb and that part, then you will certainly know that it is penetrating; and therefore do not work on that one, because there is no cure in that, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	However, they may say that it heals certain people at times.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And for the treatment by which one hopes to heal them quickly, you make subtle cauterizations according to the size of the fistula, as mentioned above, and insert that hot iron into the fistula until it reaches around the core; then repeat this process two or three times until you know that all the flesh surrounding the fistula, which is similar to a quill of pen ink, has healed.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then attend to those with wrapped bandages until all the flesh that is adjacent is healed, and treat those wounds with medications that nourish and strengthen the flesh, and if it heals well; otherwise, it will not be healed in any time through other treatments.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	If the attempt enters, but does not penetrate into the deep tissues, and between that and the attempt, there is a thin layer of flesh or muscle, and the fistula reaches to the surface of the skin, then dry the skin from the beginning of the fistula, and watch as the attempt dries, and continue this process until the drying of the attempt reaches the place where the tip of the attempt enters, and by the attempt, it is freed and cut.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then cleanse those infected flesh that resemble a canal of penance and are not opened for any reason.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	If a discharge of pus appears between you and your operation when examining those flesh, then the best thing to do is to use a clean instrument heated by fire or acute medicine, for cauterization with fire adjusts both good and bad habits: it is suitable for those attached flesh and cuts off the pus by drying out the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then treat those wrapped in calluses or hardened flesh that cause pain in the affected area, and take care of the infection with hot embers or hard, infected flesh that generates and solidifies a cure.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And these medicines consist of sting and excision; when the pain is relieved, it is healed and you need not fear recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	If a fistula has already penetrated into the perineum and is elongated from the surface of the body, then insert the finger into the anus and investigate that area carefully.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And so if you sense a tumor and between you and it there is clearly a soft or fleshy substance, and it is prone to penetration, then it is not an operation on it but rather through a path of trust and hope.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The treatment for this condition can be administered in three ways: first, by cauterizing it as we have mentioned; second, by drying it out so that you can return the intestine to its cavity, and place your hand over the area to prevent the intestine from protruding, without performing a surgical incision since you will not know the extent of the tear containing the intestinal contents, and thus do contrary to the patient's best interests; or third, by carefully curing it as we have said, elongating that tissue, and draining the pus that has formed within it so close to the anus, again as we have mentioned, or by attempting or using another instrument of extreme acuity, and then repairing all the torn flesh in the fistula that is inside the cavity through incision, and if the opening above does not heal properly, and the fistula remains open at the anus, it will become less painful for the patient.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases, the fistula is ended in this manner: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is at the side of the anus around the surface of the body and at the margin of the anus, take the probe of the perforating extremity, which is thus with a needle prepared to pierce the skin in this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert yourself into that wound enveloped in lint or around those; and then insert the probe into the fistula until you reach its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	If it is penetrant at the margin of the anus very deeply, then you extract the thread from that trap by inserting the tip into the anus; and you extract the end of the thread and adjust both ends, then open each one, and leave it for a day or two, and when you more deeply insert the thread into the flesh, open it until those flesh parts are opened between the two ends of the thread and they fit.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the opening of the fistula is not deep enough, then make it penetrate in some way as you are prepared, either with forceps or other means, for it is not appropriate for you to do this yourself so as not to hurt; and then treat it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spade with which the fistula is incised: its curvature is very acute and the other edge is not, so as not to hurt what is unnecessary when you cut.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	On the stitching of hemorrhoids where pus runs from the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two types, either they are between the buttocks resembling coal, or those are with a mass of grainy fat.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And they are small and large, the heat flows from them at that time and it is one, it is many, it comes out of them, and in their extremities.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that are open only in the anus are usually due to a lack of moisture, from which clear or slightly yellow urine or a little blood flows continuously, and they are according to the color of the body.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for that which is inside the anus is to order the patient to sit down and press until the pain subsides and the hemorrhoids appear to you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then hold on tightly and suspend yourself or have someone hold you, and close your eyes. Then cut open those parts that need it, and reduce the swelling.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	If the cuts are not held in those parts due to their moisture and softening, then take a rough cloth or a towel or woolen thread, and pull out the threads from the roots, and then cut them and sprinkle some powdered substances over them at the incision, so that they adhere to those places instead of cauterization; or cauterize them as mentioned in the previous chapter on cauterizing.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then attend to those and other remedies until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	And if the hernia does not obey and comes out, then dissect the malady by making small incisions, wash with water that is in the wound and helps to expel it more easily when the hernia protrudes.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, their cause is light, and it is because you take those with your fingers, or those with a candle, and make incisions in them, and then attend to them with water as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And for whoever makes the incision, know how to administer sutures according to this method: take a thin thread wrapped around your finger, insert it into the hemorrhoid from above, and pass the other end through the opening of the opposite side beneath the needle, and then wrap the two ends of the thread around the base of the hemorrhoid outside of the needle, and stretch it taut; and close the hemorrhoid with strong pressure, tie the thread tightly, and remove the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do it thoroughly, leaving none of them untouched, so that the excess of blood flows from that part.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place your weight on the cloth soaked in hot oil or wax; press it onto the wound and instruct the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then leave that inside the wound; and when it heals, apply ointment or other treatment until it is completely cured.
De curacio de fistulas.	**Curation of Fistulas**
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Fistulas may occur due to drying out of an opening or due to constriction from natural causes.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And if they are old and no longer respond to that medicine, you will need to open them with a pointed instrument or with your finger, ensuring they remain moist and free from any pus, which prevents their consolidation; then treat them until they are consolidated.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you should stop those parts from bleeding more violently than the first, which have been cut and are raw; and promptly tend to those that need healing.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of hernias is crucial.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that hernias are crucial, and if they appear red according to the color of the skin resembling a thumb, they should be treated immediately throughout the body, especially in the areas around the feet and legs, and through these pains you must address them.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And so it is necessary to incise what is in the area of the hernia, and hold it with forceps or a hook, and eradicate it from its origin; and promptly tend to that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, cauterize according to what is mentioned in the preceding chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	May a verrucous growth be a small, rough, round ulceration on the surface of the body, often seen in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the treatment for it is to stretch and incise that, or clean it with a sharp tool inside the wound.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or acute medicine, as we have said.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And now they (the growths or conditions) are eradicated with the tool that you have mentioned.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	May a tick (formica) be a small, hardened or fistulated growth on the body's surface that itches and, when pressed, feels like a ant bite, appearing around the body.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the treatment for it is to take a needle of goose or wolf feather, strong and sharp, and press it onto the swelling within the circle of the swelling, and then twist your hand around the needle until you have pierced what lies within the circuit of the swelling, and place it into the depth of the flesh, and uproot the swelling from its root.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, make this as a needle of iron or bronze in this manner:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The removal of the needle should be subtle, gentle (not perforating), wrapped around itself so that when it is lifted from the swelling, the pressure on it is alleviated and its rotation is controlled.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish to cauterize the swelling, as mentioned above in the chapter on cautery.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of instruments that are administered to give heat.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes heat is applied with silver or bronze or iron that has been melted or shaped; and sometimes it is done with small or large instruments according to those used in the treatment of small children, which are small, and of those whose anus are tender or painful, the heat from such instruments should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The form of large and few heat applications:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The end of the tube above which the bag is tied should be wide according to this manner; and it is distinguished where the bag is tied as well.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the end of it inserted into the anus should be blunt (not pointed), tailored to subtlety; and on one side of its length there are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel is according to the thickness of the rays and more narrow a little.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And let the bag be filled with medicines from a bladder of an animal or sheep's skin, and its opening be a palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be punctured with many things as it revolves; and if the space between the parts is the thickness of that thing.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then insert into those parts strong, raw silk from ten threads, or surround them; adjust the bag to those parts; and when the bag is placed there, it should be tightly wrapped around the patient's thigh between two strong bands, and tie each part: The quality of tying those parts is that you fill the bag with medicine, heated according to the amount of the patient's tolerance, and be careful not to make it too tight or too loose.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then the patient should be laid on their back, raising their legs and placing a cushion underneath them where the pain is located, or a lance; and apply the pointed cautery with oil or egg albumen or a paste of fenugreek or similar. Then insert it into the anus easily, and let the minister take the bag and squeeze it two times, vigorously, so that everything in the bag is evacuated into the intestine; then remove the bag and the patient should raise their legs to the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces him to vomit, take as much as you can; and if he sleeps with that for an entire night, it will be more beneficial for healing.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	If you believe that applying heat to the pain of intestinal solutions and vomiting eases it, then you repeat the cautery until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if in the anus there are hemorrhoids or festerings, then use a gentle heat and cautery, for the cauteries of which children are made to suffer.
De curacio de las plaguas.	**Curation of Plagues**
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already said in the division of the cure for plague what is suitable for the body, and you have thus given the cure for those with great pain and according to the abundance of medicines.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it says that plagues are diversified according to where they are made by the plague and according to the place where the plague strikes.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which plagues occur are also due to the heat of fire, or an incision of space or of skin, or a blow with a lance, or a whip, or an arrow, or similar to those causes that bring on sudden deaths.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	Plagues that are in the parts of the body can also be like a plague that strikes the head, or the neck, or the foot, or the belly, or the chest, and similar to those members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And it is very important to recommend the cure for some plagues, in order to stop that reasoning and regulate concerning other plagues.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And one should begin with the simple plagues of the head, since the remembrance of the composed ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it says that when a simple plague occurs on the head without fracture, consider: if it is due to a blow or something similar, and the patient has already bitten their tongue deeply and it is a severe plague with the risk of apostema, then you should immediately perform a cerebral fleebotomy and extract the clot from the sinus according to the amount of virtue (or consistency) of the clot, unless any other cause prohibits the fleebotomy, especially if the clot that has formed from the plague is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And the fleebotomy should be performed on the opposite side of the affected plague; and attention should be paid to the patient's rest, diet, and avoiding heavy meals.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If any cause prohibits the use of fleebotomy, then the diet should be restricted and one should avoid meat and wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And regarding the plague, if it develops into cautious apostema, apply hot oil or wine with astringent properties to it.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If you are certain of the presence of an abscess, apply pressure to the sore spot, if it is recent and its pus has not yet changed the color or consistency that I will describe below, then press gently.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already changed it, apply hot compresses until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the sore is large or due to a rupture of space and similarity, and the edges of it are not suitable for closing by means of ties, then close them with stitches as I will describe regarding their stitching.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the sore has already exposed bone and penis, and it is not an enclosure but a small suspension, then incise it and treat the wound with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in the place of the wound, and order the patient to abstain from foods that are coarse: caps, grains, and similar things, until it is healed.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find putrefaction in the bone that does not adhere to the bone, then you incise all of it and remove it, and then care for it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If these plagues are an artery or vein from which pus flows and it is not drained by medicines, then you should inquire about the artery, and if you find one that is not incised, you should incisively cut it or tie it; and if cauterization is necessary to prevent the pus from discharging, do so until the pus is drained.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, their cause is considered minor; so you sprinkle over them this powder, as it solidifies in front of the air changing those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	And the manner of the powder is this: take oil from crushed herbs, dragon's blood from two parts, and unextinct caus from three parts; mix all thoroughly and grind it fine, and with this fill the plague, and constrain it tightly so that it adheres well to the affected area, and coagulate it with pus.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten it over the poultice and leave it, without loosening it while it is in that state, for the medicine will not take effect until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And at other times, it is treated only with cautery, when there is no acute pain or inflammation.

And this surgical procedure is also performed on large hernias when it is deemed necessary to pause them and tighten them, and they are recent hernias with fresh inflammation, where the air has not yet altered them.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has altered them, especially during summer, then one cannot understand the position of this poultice, but rather treat them as we have said, either by tightening over the blisters with a paste made from wheat flour and water and honey until they get a crust, or treat them with other remedies as they heal.

E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And you should say the cure for skull fractures, which are deadly.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the plague of the colon.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	If the plague occurs in the colon, then it is not different in treatment, and between the plague of the head when it is simple.

If the nerves or arteries of the colon are cut, then if it is a nerve, there is no need for immediate treatment, but rather to avoid the cure from causing intense pain, as well as applying and binding something that acts like vitriol and similar substances to prevent damage to the nerves and tighten them.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres. If the spine is already incised from the throat down, and the veins of the collar are saved, then you adjust the edges of the wound with sutures over the bone of the throat and do not touch that; first equalize it and return it to its natural shape, then tighten it decently, leave it for a few days, and care for it with ointment in which there is stiffness and excitement until healing occurs.

If the plague has already made an impression in the bone, then probe it, and if there are fragments of decay within it, extract as many as you can; leave what is not suitable for you, until the plague has subsided, and separate it and remove it from the body.

And if there is no depth in it and the illness is recent with its pain, then you should apply to it from the first hour powder, and do not tighten that so that the pain is not held deep within and returns to the heart and worsens the patient's condition; rather, apply to it a soothing ointment, and untie those two times per day.

Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If the bones are not separated, leave them inside so that the pain subsides, as extraction of them is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other pains that occur in other members, the treatment during healing is similar to what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal pains.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The disposition that occurs in the stomach is either great, or small, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	For the great, some visible protrusions may be seen in the intestine or intestinal nerves, so that their intrusion and suturing require both strength and delicacy.

And when a small disruption is caused, it is difficult to be rectified by other means, and I know that the reduction of them is much more difficult if you do not take care of their reinsertion into their place immediately, for they open and thicken, making it difficult to insert them.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas. E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each of you, exposition and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, it is said that when the hernia is small and there is no visible cause from within the abdomen, and it is difficult to reduce, then it presents in one of two ways: either due to the fragility of the rupture as we have said, or when the hernia experiences inflammation because of the coldness of the air.

And therefore, when it is in this condition, you should wrap it with a cloth soaked in lukewarm water, or use water containing vinegar, sage, and spices, and apply this to the hernia until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And in some cases, they use wine, which has a drying effect, and it is better than just water for resolving inflammation.

E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it is appropriate to avoid cutting, and there is no need to secate or drain.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, see its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	One part of the sharp knife, and another part of the blunt knife, with a fine tip, but not too sharp, should be preferred over a spatula.

When the disruption is extensive, and it occurs in the lower part of the belly, you must have the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; and if it occurs in the upper part of the belly, then you must elevate the patient's head and feet above the openings.

E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And also, you must manage this in great pains and in small pains.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in small pains, apply what you have prepared, and then make the minister be between your fingers, who has the whole disruption in his hand and adjusts the lips of it, and then gradually uncover from one to another until any cause of the suture is discovered elsewhere.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count one needle according to the amount of the width of the wound; then place it near the extremity of the tear in the ring finger, and tighten the needle, so that you do not push through both ends of the cord, but rather push it through the gap left inside, until you have added both ends of the cord and both ends of the phalanx, and thus you make four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	Then tighten the thread double around the needle, and in some cases, join both parts together, and add the two lips and the wound through proper addition; then reduce the thickness of the finger and insert another needle into that one, and attach it to the thread as if it were the first needle; do not stop doing this with the needles until you have completed the entire contraction of the wound.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of varying thicknesses, from coarse to fine, as the thin needles penetrate the flesh slightly, while the thick ones are difficult to insert into the cord; therefore, it is necessary that they be both coarse and fine in thickness.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio. E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And do not prolong the stitches, so that the disease is not hindered from consolidating.

However, the second type of stitch is as follows: you administer a single stitch to all four ends (of the leg and two ends of the hip), at once, using a needle with thread meticulously and appropriately wrapped around it in terms of fineness and thickness.

And when you have inserted the needle through these four extremities, withdraw the needle from that split middle part from which it began, so that the thread retracts the pus-filled gap from the wound, so that the suture is as secure as a drape with which the drapes are tightened.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And between each suture, leave the thickness of your little finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this suture heals men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And with this type of suture, I have treated a wound that had occurred in a man's stomach, which was infected by a knife, and it was a rupture of the wound measuring about a palm, and there were disruptions around two palms from the abdominal wound, and then I reduced that part where the abdomen had been wounded for 24 hours.
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	And the plague, once consolidated in the space of 15 days or so, is cured and considered healed; and it may recur for many years, and is converted into its conditions.
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat. Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	But I will tell you two kinds of stitching according to the narration of the word.
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	And indeed, you begin the stitching of the wound, and insert the needle from outside to inside.
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat. E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida. Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Gaul.

Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	The treatment of one disease should be judged according to other diseases.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa. De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	On the treatment of ulcers and fistulas.

And if the disease does not respond and heal as it should, then you will know that you have not achieved complete eradication of the corruption; so then uncover it again, carefully and accurately perform the reason for it and the purification from it with the last strength you have, and then restore it.

If you are not prepared to remove the bones from your patient, then place your hands over the area where the pain is most intense, and leave it there until the pain subsides, ensuring that the pain does not spread to nearby bones or tissues, and be careful that the incision you have made in your operation does not become infected.
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	Previously, if you are afraid, place a cloth soaked in hot oil or Egyptian water or any of the green oils on the area, for when these ligaments are separated and the bones are removed from their attachment, this attraction is alleviated.
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	If it is a large bone, such as of the leg or thigh or similar, and what is corrupt from it is only the outer part, then carefully cut away this corrupted portion only until the blackness and corruption are removed, and then restore the area.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If the part that is corrupt is a significant portion, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it becomes necessary to close and completely cut out that area where the corruption has set in, and once it is healed, treat it.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you enter into the patient's thigh to hold that in place, serving as an example and assistant to your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	Focus on a young man around 30 years old who experiences pain in his thigh, and among the symptoms inside are signs of inflammation within the body until the material reaches the thigh, and it is material related to abscesses or great abscesses, and do not focus on external causes for him.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And so the time extends for this condition due to errors of the doctors as the abscess grows larger, and it attracts mobile materials, and its treatment is delayed until the thigh becomes fistulated, causing horrific wounds that result in decay and body humidity.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And thus, after a multitude of physicians spent two years treating it without focusing on the cause but rather on the symptoms, you were called in.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And I saw the hernia and the fluid that was running from it through the large opening; the condition of that man was completely stabilized, and his skin had a citron-like color.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And thus, you inserted the probe into one of those openings and reached the bone with the probe.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then, you examined all the openings and discovered the cause of their condition from every part of the hernia.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And thus, I carefully examined and incised one of those openings until I discovered a bone fragment, which I found corrupted, hardened, and degenerated; the hernia was already penetrated and corrupted by an impure substance within the mesentery.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then secure what I have uncovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I thought it was not in the bone but that corruption which I had removed and secured, and I had already washed it away.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	Then I interrupted the restoration of the plague with consolative medicine for a long time, and it is not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And I repeated the uncovering over the bone secondarily according to the initial discovery, and found continued corruption from the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I secured what appeared to me as that corruption, and then I had made an incision to heal it and restore it, but it is not restored.
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	And then I uncovered it again and did not incise the bone little by little particularly and perforate its restoration, and it is not restored until I cut around a palm of it, and that one was extracted from its marrow, and then I restored it with medicines, and it is slightly consolidated and healed.
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	And no further repetition in the operation of cutting it is necessary unless for the arrangement of its fragility and the lack of his tolerance, and fear of his death, as he suffers at all times due to the superfluity of evacuation, a bad syncope.
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	And therefore health is achieved through complete healing, and nothing is in place of the hard bone; its arrangement within his body is good and restores his virtue; it adjusts to its dispositions and does not cause him opposition in walking or harm for any reason.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if the bone is prominent in the body, then you must act as follows: take lint and tightly wrap it around the end of that prominent bone, and ask someone to extend that limb; then apply a thicker lint over the first one, and close it onto the flesh left uncovered, extending the end of it so that you can uncover the flesh where you want to make an incision, without damaging the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a fence or table beneath the bone, for when you do this, the saw that cuts through the rotten flesh is not hindered.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And be careful with the cutting at the corrupted place little by little, for if the corruption is in the concave part of the bone and does not appear on its outer surface, it may require another cut.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupted and not prominent, it often continues in one piece or in parts, and the corruption may be at the middle or in a part of it; then you must remove all the flesh from all sides; and place a fence beneath, and make a saw cut on the first part where the corruption begins until the cut through the other part is continued.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And make the cut according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in a joint, cut through that corrupt joint, and close the bone where it continues from the other side.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in their ratio but must be treated ingeniously.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest or foot of the hand, it is very difficult; nevertheless, you must inquire about the corruption how it appears to you, and burn that, and remove that according to some disposition possible to you, and in such a way ingeniously rectify it so that no vein or nerve is harmed.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know which saws and chisels are suitable for cutting these bones, depending on the position of the bones, their preparation, thickness, subtlety, size, hardness, and rarity; so it is necessary that you prepare a suitable instrument for every kind of operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you should know that this operation signifies to you regarding the type of instrument of which you are in need; since you have great study and long experience of the methods of this art, and testimony of ways of illness, when you have already seen for yourself what is appropriate for it among instruments for all illnesses.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And in the end of this chapter, you will learn the number of instruments which you will hold with examples as you process to perfect your prohibition which you will experience on others.

E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not advisable to squeeze the heads of the joints unless they are corrupted or the mouth is widely open.
