Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	The form of the ray that is suitable for reason of him who is pierced by bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of a sharp point.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian steel, and in a way that all the causes we have mentioned of razors and scissors and saws are covered.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the incision of the extremity and of the locking of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be caused either intrinsically or extrinsically, or if the treatment you apply to that corruption does not bring relief, and the corruption persists without any external cause, then you must incise that member within which the malady is confined so that it may heal from death or decay that is causing significant damage to the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that which happens is that the member becomes black where it is covered by a hot burn, or you may find the darkness extending as the inflammation spreads to other parts of the body that are connected to it; and thus you must make an incision on that part.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, it is caused by the corruption and percussion of certain venomous sources such as those from a marine scorpion or viper or nettle, and similar things.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or percussion is in the tip of the finger, you should incise the finger and not give space to the corruption so that it does not extend to the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly, if it affects the hand, you should incise at the base of the finger and not give space to the corruption until it reaches the joint of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you replace that, then incise the arm inside the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another corruption passes and the joint is affected again, then that is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause for healing in this case is a matter of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, when there is corruption in the foot, you incise it inside one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if you take hold of the sole of the foot, then you incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	If it is possible to enter the toe joint, then you incise the leg inside the toe joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toe, then it offers no cure but dismissal, and leaves the patient to their fate.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of cutting or severing a member is that you tighten the ligament in the area you wish to cut, and tighten another ligament over the place; and extend the instrument one ligament beyond the other, and extend the minister another ligament upon it; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments without causing a wide gap until all the flesh is exposed; and then it is either cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover it with cloth from all sides so as not to touch the place itself, and bring the injured patient to a calm and safe state.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	If bleeding occurs during the operation, cauterize the place carefully, or apply some powdery substances to constrict the blood; and then return to your medication until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the affected member with suitable ligaments, and treat it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you to rise this man from his bed, these circumstances that you and I have agreed upon, which has resulted in a dark mark on his foot due to the adjustment that was akin to the burn of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption, which was initially caused in the deepest part of his foot, tends to spread throughout the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for this condition, knowing that the cure is coming to his member with the violence of his pain and the adjustment of it, and he cuts into the foot at the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that malady has afflicted him in the big toe as indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it left me, and I felt compelled to reflect on the nature of this condition, as if it were a medicine that rests upon the body; I sought purification for his body, and the excess did not resurface, and they began moving to the other toe where they had started in the foot.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the doctor attempts to cut into the patient's hand, but he does not want to do this hoping for some relief from that excess, and if you must continue the incision of the patient's hand, it is because the virtue of the illness was in its destruction.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he has recovered from me, he returned to his land and defeated me by making the man prepare and cut into his hand completely, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And this account has not been provided merely to describe this illness, but also to assist those who suffer from it, and to explain its meaning and the way in which it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Regarding the treatment of wounds and the quality of enema therapy with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy part of the body and the space of the abscess is prolonged as far as a collection of pus, then it ruptures and perforates, and the pus flows out of it, leaving the area hollowed out as if from a vessel, and the skin above it remains intact, and is not subject to further destruction, and does not press on the bone or nerves or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Although if the space is prolonged such that the corruption fully involves a member, then it is called a fistula and not incurable.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure for it is to cut through that entire cord as it is twisted, especially when it is subtile and made with thread, and ensure that it does not adhere to the location due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the cord will adhere and that that corruption will not act through any further consequence, and in the cord has passed through the face, then cure it with a cleansing enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the wound, and if it is large, and the arm that it affects has a foul odor, then cleanse it with an Egyptian medicine made of oil, wine, and honey, received in equal parts, and placed in a vessel, then heated over fire until the medicine becomes hot and reaches the specific quality of good.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then, take from him what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; wash out the affected sinus with this, tighten the openings of the sinuses, and leave the medicine inside for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then, extract that foreign body; do this for as many days as it takes to clean the sinus and heal the wound.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	In some cases, the sinus is washed out with water from ashes, when this medicine is not available to you; for you take the ash of an oven, mix it with water, and then use this mixture to wash out the sinus until you feel that the sinus has been cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient is intolerant to Egyptian medicine or ash water, then wash out the sinus with a mixture of honey and water, and also mix in some wine and honey; for honey cleanses and washes, while wine causes the sinus to adhere, especially when there has been an excess of stiffness and dryness from the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And after you have done this several times and feel that the swelling has subsided, then cleanse that part with water which causes flesh to grow there.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And indeed, you should take a mixture of dyphencicon and dissolve that oily crust and apply astringent; or cleanse that part with some medicine mixed with ointments which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifices of the swelling are tight and do not receive the catheter of the clisteri, then gradually widen them with a small iron, and place in it hot water wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon until they are widened.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the orifices seem wide, then you should close them with stitches and leave it with enough quantity so that the clisteri can be added.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the orifice of the patient from which the arm exits is raised above its usual position, dry that part at the base where it is located in the patient so that the arm runs between them, for when the arm is constrained in the depth of the sinew, flesh will be generated there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinew within the bone joint at the base as you wish, then pierce and prepare the member so that the arm can run from it lightly according to what you have prepared, without any cause for retention of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are gently applied to the sinew, appropriately choosing those over cloth from them.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such a quantity that it covers all the sinew; then, cut with scissors along the right side of the orifice of the sinew, making a slit somewhat wider than the orifice; and extend over another piece of cloth the size of the wound according to the amount of the cut, placing it over that for a distant position from the orifice of the sinew so that the exit of the arm from the patient is prevented and the cloth is not too large but rather changed every few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	He who is above the sinus opening, whom you massage at all times to prevent what is tight in it from dislocating from the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from the arm is hot or cold, or digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And so consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain in it or not, and if there is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see that the matter that has collected over the sinus opening has adhered, or formed a strong adhesion, on certain days, remove it gently, and on the third day, when you dislodge the affliction, change the bandage and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	Make a small opening in the sinus, if it is infected with a subtle virus; do not be anxious about the adhesion of it, for healing itself belongs to it, for some people take a long time for new flesh to form in their wounds, and others have the opposite effect.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinew a hard and indigest bract has separated over time, you will know that the sinew does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinew is prolonged, then adjust in the drying of medications, and if the medications are humid in their substance and virtue, they become dry like with a healing unguent when there is too much superfluity added for protection.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last method, by which it is cured, is to take a healing unguent and dissolve it in warm oil, and apply it over it as if it were another substance, and then gently massage it into that area.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems to act in the same way when there is no bract, using healing unguent mixed with honey, which should be thick, and apply it; or take myrrh and aloe, mix them, grind them into a powder over fire, wrap that in cloth and press it on the sinew; and use that same honey, which you observed to be thick, grind it into cloth and press it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And at times, they administer to him long-drawn-out and finely cut lilies of the celestial (i.e., Aloe) plant, and chickpea flour, and centaury, and use these simples either pure or mixed, triturate them and sieve them and sprinkle them over honey which has been refined; and apply it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the vein is prolonged and not healed by this treatment, you will know that the corruption is in the duct of the vein, and it has affected the bones or other hard members or the ligaments; then you treat it with fistular treatment, as is said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Regarding the treatment of ulcers, burnt skin, and added finger incisions, and amputation.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Ulcers are a suppuration that does not heal from the fingernail of the hand or foot, and it strongly affects the other fingers, and as it prolongs without treatment, it becomes either a cauterized ulcer or corrupt, and pus flows within that corrodes the root of the nail, and it strongly corrupts the entire nail, and its corruption reaches the bone within, and an offensive odor emanates from it, and the end of the finger is affected, and its color turns dull.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so when you have that which we have mentioned in the division and do not comply with your treatment, then know that you should scrape off all the superfluity that is stuck to the nail and then apply a hot cautery to the wound near it, for cauterization brings relief to such things.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is strong and the nail is healthy, but the additions of the nail already penetrate the flesh, and they begin to pierce and hurt it, then know that you should make a subtle cut at the angle of the painful nail, push it away from the flesh, cut the flesh easily, and apply poultices of medicinal, non-corrosive substances until it is completely healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	If the corruption has already penetrated into the bone, then know that you should scrape out the bone and extract it, for there is no health where the bone is corrupt.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you observe corrosion and destruction in the said area, you will incise it into one of the nuts according to its memory, and then treat it until it is healed.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If there is an urgent need for percussion or scraping in the affected area, and if this causes intense pain, then you should begin by applying a flebotomical instrument to the illness, and carefully dry the nail with a sharp spatula, cutting across it from above, but be careful not to penetrate the flesh that remains under the nail; otherwise, you will cause the illness to become more painful and give rise to excessive adhesion of the flesh in the area, and thus create an even greater problem. And treat the affected spot accordingly so that the pain subsides.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	However, this adjustment, which is natural in the bodies of many people, is characterized by a large amount of flesh on some and a lot of bones in others, or a significant presence in their nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them originate in the formation of joints, or it is their nature to be present in certain nuts of these parts.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	He who is born in ignorance of this knowledge will not be harmed, but he who is born with strong joints is more susceptible to harm.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those who are born with tender flesh, the section is easier, and it is that you insert the blade of a scalpel into their skin gently.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	He who is born with the condition affecting the joints, treatment is difficult; therefore, be wary of the excision of them.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	In the case of those born with such knowledge, be careful to incise the flesh at the beginning roundly into the bone, and then use a suitable saw to close it, and take care that it heals properly.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	In the consolidation that occurs between the joints, whether due to frequent use or by nature in a person who lacks this knowledge, or because of a hernia or fire burn, or similar, then be careful to remove that consolidation so that the joints return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And then place between their sheets, soaked in warm oil, to prevent the joints from becoming stiff, and separate them with a thin lead sheet until they are consolidated as needed.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly, if consolidation occurs in certain areas of the palm, then dry that consolidation according to what is prepared and suitable for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	In the treatment of veins, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Veins become varicose, which are thick, twisted veins filled with melancholic surplus fluid that appears in most parts of the body's members, most notably in the legs, especially in those who walk, work, and carry heavy loads.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, it is necessary for you to administer purgation to the body from black choler sometimes with strong expulsion, and drain the patient's blood from the basil vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment for their pain is according to two methods: one is to incise and remove that black blood, and the other method is to raise the vein and extract all of it.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is made according to this method: first, they begin by cutting into the leg with a sharp instrument, while ensuring that the thick blood clot is resolved, which is foul from the leg, and then they firmly grip the patient's thigh at the highest point of pain, below which they make an opening. They cut the vein in one, two, or three places with a wide incision, raise the black blood clot using the upper part of the incision within the leg, and from above, through the opening between the thighs, until all the desired quantity is removed, as much as needed to alleviate the patient's condition.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then they close that opening, and order the patient to avoid foods that cause black gallstones.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And repeat the treatment through phlebotomy when the veins are full and this marks the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	The elevation of the patient should be done in this manner: you who spread the patient's legs, if they are stiff with cold, then immerse them in water and wet the camba (bandage) around their leg with lukewarm water until the veins become prominent; or if due to intense exercise, the member is sore, then rub it with a hot compress.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the cord at the right of the vein by section, in the middle or at the end, or at the lowest part, you should tie it off.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then cut the cord with scissors and extract the vein from all parts until it appears healthy, and you should examine the patient, observing if the disease is declining towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And so when you have freed it from the chains, you will see that white thing which is the string.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	Then take your tools and insert the lever into that space which is raised and freed from the chains, and suspend all heavy objects with them.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then make another cut, perpendicular to the first, and carefully remove the chains from the vein so that it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then raise that one and cut it deeply in the rear section, close to the root, and extract it, raising it until it comes out through the second section, and then remove it from the section above it.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you have removed the one from the highest or most superior section among all of them, ensuring that all are extracted, and then cut it.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not succeed in extracting and lifting it, insert a strong double-ended needle, tie it there, and extract it, or leave the hook and turn your hand inside where it is stuck.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to cut it; for if it breaks, it is difficult to lift that part, and it comes back to harm the patient through that wound.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And once that is completely removed, place your attention on the affected area, immersing it in wine and applying both warm and cold oils, and heal it until it is cured.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the vein is contracted without torsion or winding, and it is not in the right position as we have said, you must make an opening on that part of its torsion and at the places where it winds, and then suspend it with cuts until you lift it completely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And be careful not to pierce the vein or harm it, for it will be difficult for you to raise it up; and use your prudence in that regard.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the injury that is dried out:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of an incision:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It should not be too sharp with incisions, nor have an excessively acute point, so as not to harm the vein; rather, it should be of considerable flexibility, for if it is too thin, it will pierce the vein because of its thinness; we say this about its superfluous thickness.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the thigh.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs, as it were, in hot regions, just as the hernia occurs in the abdomen of Arabs and in the hindlands and arid lands of India, where there is little moisture or greenery.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And much heat is generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the growth of the hernia is a putrefaction that can be seen when snakes, worms, and maggots emerge from within the body, causing destruction between the hernia and flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of the impending arrival of the hernia is when a severe inflammation occurs in the leg, the area becomes swollen, and the vein begins to protrude from the site of this swelling, resembling a plant's root.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And when the hernia's edge becomes visible, you must then wrap around it a piece of lead as heavy as a dragon's weight. Then take that lead and let it hang suspended from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And whenever the hernia causes any discomfort or pain due to external factors, wrap it in lead and apply pressure to it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the pain persists, you insert a blade into it and wrap the raw area; do not cut the one that is inflamed within until it has come out, for if you cut the latter, it contracts and enters the flesh, causing abscesses and putrefaction at the site and bad ulcers.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For the pain that requires additional treatment and extraction, it is asked to be removed gradually, until it has come out completely from the back of it, without leaving any cause of its presence in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some people have reported that it is of the length of one's palm and fingers, and I myself have seen it come out from a distance of ten palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is cut during the time of its treatment, then insert the blade into the channel of it and pierce that long channel through the flesh, until everything in the matter has been evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the site for some days using medicines; and then care for it for the healing of abscesses.
