And this vein is sometimes seen to have great swelling, especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or on the foot itself, and it causes much horrifying pain, which arises from each painful branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore, treat that thus as we have said in the division and refer to what is mentioned above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding the section about worms generated under the skin, and it is called bovine inflammation.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This disease is called bovine fever in some countries because it causes great pain and debilitation throughout the body, pushing and weakening the limbs until the tendon ruptures and it is expelled.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of this disease is due to the putrefaction of certain humors, which cause worms and snakes and roundworms and tapeworms in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared by the evil of the hernia, for when it enters the body and rises to the head, it penetrates through the blood vessel and breaks up the blood, and this must be treated with care.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And so when you want to cure and extract it, it should not be done unless you understand its movement and appearance in the body, and then you must grasp what is above it and what remains below it tightly, and then apply pressure over it and extract it.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is embedded in the flesh and does not disturb you, then apply a hot cautery over the place where it resides, and the main cause that is feared is the corruption of the hernia which also corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	If it has reached the head near the blood vessel, then tighten the upper eyelid with strong pressure, and apply pressure over it, and extract it; and take care that the patient undergoes purification of their body with medicines that evacuate corrupt, bad humors, and be cautious of foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On the incision above the disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This disease is called nefri in our land, and it is a pain that appears in some members, and then changes from one member to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And you have already seen that second one that I recommended.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	You have been called to a village for a female patient, and upon examining her arm, you discovered a small inflammation in the vein at the wrist. After breaking it open, as one does when looking at pus, you saw that it was filled with living-looking white material as it oozed from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then all the pain from that place subsided and you felt it in the muscle, then you compressed it for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then correct the other side until you reach the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I realized that I had to turn myself over in the bed, according to what I had seen; and it was too wonderful of the changes in him and of the speed with which he moved from one member to another.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this in my feet according to that manner; however, I have seen many which cause terrible pain to be changed from one member to another.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have never seen this in the feet like on women.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think that this was anything but that it is because the woman was old, with thin body and exposed veins, and in this condition appears the sensation of that changed air.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is necessary that this retrograde treatment does not appear in those who are delicate and have a moist body with clogged veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you wish to cure it and the patient feels that pain, do not appear to give aid as we have said, but strengthen over that place and let it rest slightly and dry out on that area where that air is restricted, and cauterize the spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	If you do not find it in your shoes, then cure that which causes the body's air to be expelled and that which follows, and bind those made with foul pills and serpents and similar things.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows vary according to species and according to the parts of the body in which they are caught, for their diversity lies in that some have sharp points, and small, and concave, and dull ones; others have three angles, and some have tongues; and yet others have barbs.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And according to the members and parts in which it strikes, it is divided into two manners: for the primary members, such as the head, heart, lungs, spleen, ribs, bladder, and their like, when it attacks any of these members and manifests itself by your signs of death, you must know that you should avoid extraction of this arrow from those parts where death is the greatest, and when these ill signs do not appear in you, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then extract that and cure the affliction.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And among the signs of the servant is when an arrow strikes in it, and passes through the bone, and comes out from the base which is over the brain, due to the violent soda, and scotomias, and vertigo, and pain in the legs, and inflammation and pain of the tongue, and spasms and confusion of speech, and raging vomiting, and a strong loss of words, and destruction of voice, and comes out from the place of the affliction white humidity resembling powder, and blisters like the consistency of flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And if these signs appear to you, then abstain from treatment and extraction of the arrow, unless it is protruding.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	If the arrow enters the heart, so that it is near the left breast, and you feel a hard impact where it is lodged, not a visible cause; and strongly feel the movement of the arrow similar to the pulse, and the flow of black pus, and there is chilling in the extremities, shortness of breath, and fainting; then know that death is at hand.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has pierced the lung, showing pus from the plague, and the vessels near the collarbone are infected, and the patient's condition changes, and they gasp for air heavily, and seeks attraction of fresh air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow pierces the membrane in the foot, and the pain is close to the small ribs, and there is a great deal of pain with violent sobs, and all the muscles of the body are not at their best.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrow hits the stomach, one feels strong pain from the eating of undigestible food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if the arrow strikes the abdomen and becomes lodged there, it causes a tear from the wound or the membrane or intestine that has burst, and there is no hope of healing from removing the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow hits the bladder and lets urine escape outside, it causes pain from some internal cause, and strong pain is felt by the patient; then you know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	The other members (i.e., parts of the body) such as the face, neck, back, shoulders, hips, spine, and leg joints can also be saved according to the best dispositions when the arrow does not hit a vein or artery and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will tell you about what I have seen regarding the nature of these arrows, so that you understand this in regard to human healing.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause of which is that when an arrow pierces the lacrimal duct of a man in the root of his nose, and it is extracted from him on the other side, leaving the grays of his ear unharmed, then he is cured, and there is no harm to his nasal passage.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And another arrow was extracted from a Jew, which had embedded itself in his eye, leaving the eyelid below, and the arrow was hidden and could not be removed from there except for a small tip to which it clung, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, capable of piercing a lion without losing its blade.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew was healed, and there was no further harm to his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And extract another arrow from a Christian man who had been struck in the groin, which was an Arabic arrow, and it is that one with the sharp point; then I incised through it between two guides, and it was already sunk into the patient's groin; so I became subtle with it, and then extracted it, and the Christian is healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who had been struck in his belly, and I thought he would die from it; so, after having passed thirty days without any change in his condition due to the disposition of the humors, I incised through the arrow and put pressure on it, and he was healed, and there was no further harm to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw a man in whom an arrow had struck his back, and the wound was deeply entrenched within him, and after setting fire nearby, I removed the arrow at the base of the wound.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman in whom an arrow had struck her belly, and the wound was deeply entrenched within her, and it did not change in its disposition over time, and the woman did not experience any great discomfort in any of her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And he sees another man to whom an arrow has struck his face and the wound is deep; he removes the arrow, causing little pain, but many similar marks.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And he extracted the arrow from the prince of the king who had been struck in the middle of his nose; it had already inclined to the right side a little, and the entire arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And you were called for the treatment of him, so that within three days the arrow's entry point would heal.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then he examined the arrow wound very closely; and then he inquired about that subtle attempt, not feeling it; but he felt a sharp pain behind his right ear, and then he hoped that that pain was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And he applied a plaster to the place with an absorbent and digestive effect, trusting that by doing so, the location of the arrow would appear to him, so that it would dry up over that spot.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not be concerned about the place where the arrow has struck; continue applying the plaster to it for several days and no further accidents will occur; and, as the plague hardens, break up the swelling from the extraction of the arrow in intervals of several days until one day you feel the arrow inside its socket and I reconnect it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then you should apply acute corrosive medicine to the wound for several days until a fire opens up, and you should gently soothe it, and cut away the tip of the arrow, which adheres to the wood.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then you should adjust the opening of the wound with that acute medicine until I see the tip of the arrow clearly, and I spend time on this for intervals of time over four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And when the wound becomes enlarged, I then try to insert scissors into it and hold them there, without moving, until one day I am able, through clever methods, to pull it out with forceps, as will be described in detail at the end of this chapter; and then I restore the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors believe that the cartilage of the nose cannot be restored, and they restore it so that the disease is consolidated, and the malady is healed entirely, without any pain in it for any reason.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recommend to you the quality of extraction of certain arrows in order to give this rule and meaning regarding what I have not said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those in question are not understood from the narration nor do they comprehend those in the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the skilled artisans compare a little about words; and regarding what is present about what is absent; and they find new operations and new instruments for the descent of strange causes from the art when accidents occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore, you say that arrows are not discharged from the members in which they are inserted, but according to two manners: either by attraction of the place into which they enter, or on the contrary side of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is discharged from the place where it enters, or is shot through a fleshy part, and then thrown out and discharged.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not observe the time when eating, then know that you must leave it for some days until the flesh around it is healed and the attraction of it and its discharge are alleviated.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it becomes stuck in the bones and you do not observe eating at the right time, leave it for some days, then repeat this process daily, and it will be discharged.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not observe your diet for some days, then know that you must puncture the path of the arrow at that bone with a delicate journey until the location is enlarged by the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if an arrow is embedded in the bone of the head and has pierced one of the ventricles of the brain, and it manifests in the patient some of those symptoms which we call, then refrain from removing the arrow and leave it there until its presence is no longer felt for a few days; for if the arrow reaches the cerebrospinal fluid, death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not embedded in the bone but only in the flesh and does not pass into the cerebrospinal fluid, and the patient recovers after a few days without any of those symptoms occurring, then devise a way to attract the arrow and pull it out.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	If it is deeply embedded and does not yield to your efforts to remove it, then administer treatments around the arrow's path as we have recommended, and tend to the site until it heals.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	If the arrow is already embedded in the body and affects a vital area, then examine that part, and if you feel any movement, apply some suitable stimulants to attract it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the constriction of the wound and the length of the arrow, here neither nerves nor veins are involved, then make an incision over the wound until it is enlarged and it becomes possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if there are auricles attached, which must be removed entirely from the tissue in which they are embedded, using all means at your disposal; and devise a way to do this, if you cannot remove the flesh around the fracture of the auricles and their torsion until it becomes possible.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you perform the extraction of the arrow in any place, use a twist of your hand and forceps at all times until it becomes firmly embedded; and with subtlety and great care, so that the arrow is not broken and can be easily removed along with it.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot reach it with your own effort, then wait for a few days until the swelling in the path of the arrow subsides, and then try again when it is relieved.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If you experience difficulty due to bleeding, then administer what we have said about treatment in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And be vigilant for any incision of veins or nerves, or string, and administer remedies in every possible way to facilitate the escape of the arrow; and do this with ease and tranquility, delay and firmness as you would for yourself and as recommended by others.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore, contract the arrow so that the malady is according to the figure by which you should aim the location of the arrow in it, as this is more beneficial.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	For the arrows that are discharged in opposition to another part, or that already process some part from outside, or make the extremity of the arrow thin due to the pressure of the part above it and turn it around, then you should focus on that; and cut it according to the quantity in which the forceps hold it; and throw it away, as it is made light for ejection.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is held in the bone, then cut with a knife according to the direction of the arrow, and widen the cut until the arrow comes out.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if this does not help after several days, then repeat the process until it heals.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the point of the arrow is in that place, then push it towards the affected area.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the point has fallen and you want to give impulsion, then insert your finger into it, if it is hard, press firmly in the concave part towards the head of the arrow, and push it towards the affected area.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrowhead is concave, then push it strongly towards the point of impact, as the arrow will be pushed away by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is embedded, then you should compress all the flesh around it, as much as you can, and tend to that area as best as you can.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow strikes the foot, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and it is close to a surface that you can touch without difficulty, and it is possible for you to remove it, then remove it without delay and beware not to cut into veins or nerves, and pull out the arrow, and treat the wound as necessary until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	A device for extracting arrows:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Their ends should be shaped like a hook, made of an appropriate material, and equipped with teeth; when they grasp the arrow, the serrated edges prevent it from slipping.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And these are made in various sizes, large and small, according to the thickness of the arrow, the depth of the wound, and the extent of its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	A method to relieve this concave extremity with external pressure so that the arrow's shaft is removed from it and the pain is eased.
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Method to relieve the sore extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	so that it pushes out the shaft of the arrow from the concave wound and relieves the pressure.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	On venipuncture or phlebotomy of veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins for phlebotomy, of which there are numerous ones, are located in the head, specifically in the area around the temples (two pulsatil veins near the ears, known as the temporal arteries), two on each side of the nose (the lacrimal veins, called "aspicient"), a vein in the middle region of the forehead, one at the tip of the nose, two at the nape of the neck, and two on either side of the lips. These are referred to as the "algelic" veins, and there are also two veins located beneath the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	When the veins that are flebotomized in the arms, of which one is a cephalic vein and requires the use of wild garlic, and the people call it "the head vein" and "sordid," and it is the median vein composed of a branch of the basilic and another branch of the cephalic; they commonly name it "the vein of the whole body." The basilic vein is the one that is stopped in the domestic armpit and is called "citellar." They commonly call the popular "ventral vein" those situated between the said auricular and the smaller one at the base. And there are two branches to each.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And on the foot and the leg there are three veins: one of them is left in the curvature of the inner side of the wild garlic; the second is superficial, and its location is left where the domestic legband rests; and the sciatic vein, whose place is left where the wild garlic band rests; and there are other veins similar to these on the band.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The treatment of the veins that are close to the auricles is for cataracts, inflammation, and ulcers of the old evil head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding from these should be as you have observed: it is to shave the patient's head and rub the patient's head on the occiput at the location of both veins with ample friction; then tighten the bandage around the patient's neck so that both appear and their locations near the auricles in two places deeply embedded in the head; and seek as they say, and if you feel the pulse of those as they say, here try this.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Now take the scalpel, and it is one that is sharp, and insert it into the vein in the neck until the incision reaches the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	Then raise your hand over the vein and bone, and incise the vein with a sharp incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision should be about two fingers' breadth, or as needed, and make the cut as deep as desired.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then, apply strong pressure with poultices and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And it has already been mentioned at the beginning of this treatise about the incision and cauterization of these parts.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But regarding the two veins and arteries that are in the thighs, their blockage during phlebotomy is an ancient and serious evil, causing frequent blindness and acute excesses of fluid in the legs.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomy on these parts depends on your judgment: forcing the patient to contract their muscles until two veins appear by direct perception, and demonstrating the pulse of their legs after the procedure; and then you should be careful.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then, raise the cord over the vein as indicated above, insert the sharp phlebotomy instrument between them, and elevate the vein; cut it thus as you have done in the other two veins; and let the blood flow according to the amount of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then, carefully tighten the compression around the patient's condition, place the indicated instrument over the vein for an hour, and apply warmth and pressure to that area until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And having previously recalled them, and made the incision, attract them toward the beginning of the opening.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And thus, the use of phlebotomy on the vein of the forehead is similar to phlebotomy of the cephalic vein for ancient illnesses of the face, migraines, and painful, foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the vein puncture depends on what you have learned; it is to tighten the patient's colon with a bandage so that the vein appears, and then take the instrument called a phlebotomist, which has this shape.
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Stop the puncturing at the prominent point of the phlebotomist on that vein and strike it with a lean or other tool in its manner, and let the blood flow according to the amount you wish; then remove the perforation from the patient's body and tighten it until it heals.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	Sometimes, the vein is opened with a wide phlebotomy, but it is not known that the phlebotomy of acute extremities is like other phlebotomies, but rather on the lateral extremity, and phlebotomize according to the transversal, because the bone is very close and strong, and the phlebotomy would be damaged in it when it is subtle.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	Avoid the jugulation of the two veins that are the tears of two wheels due to the scrape of the wheel by roughness and sebaceous in the wheels, and to the maladies of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the illness tightens the vein in a certain place, and you should then make a phlebotomy there, while standing over the patient's head.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And the phlebotomy should be made according to the transverse direction along a short distance, for in that place there is little flesh; and if the phlebotomy is subtle, then only a small part of it should be cut.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	Then let the blood flow as much as is necessary, and press upon that area, tighten it for a night, and then release it.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	Phlebotomy of the nasal vein is effective for high fever and violent sweating, and for facial illnesses and migraines and redness that occurs on the face, especially when it is long-standing.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of this phlebotomy is that it tightens the illness's hold and you should then take the patient's nose in your left hand, take a long, subtle phlebotomy, placing it in the middle part of the nose according to its straightness, for the vein does not show itself here, and soon afterward the blood begins to flow.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Ensure you complete the procedure of flebotomy little by little and let the blood flow according to your need; then close it for a night, as it is thus restored more easily.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	The application of the flebotomy on both sides should lead to the contraction of vessels, the beginning of healing, and the removal of harmful and destructive diseases and ulcers as well as with potent medicines.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the flebotomy on those is that the illness tightens itself in each one in their own cavity; and the expert should be over the head of the patient, and the patient should sit on a stool.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	Then, make small flebotomies on the vein deep in the flesh with an ample flebotomy tool; and remove the blood according to season or as much as necessary for that which you consider needed; and do similarly with another vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then tighten the ligature on both veins with a medium-tight grip to prevent the disease from spreading, and leave it within the wrap until the pain is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And regarding the surgical incisions made on the veins, it compares to small apothes and pustules in the mouth, and the corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and cracks, as well as bad ulcers that are found on the nose and around the patient's breath.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the surgical incisions for these is that it stops the disease in front of you, tightens the collar around it with a bandage, and then turns the lips inside out, examining each of the two veins, of which one is on the right side of the lip and the second on the left; and the proof of each is by the darkness of either, and this happens more often in the area surrounding them because there are small black veins there; and then you make an incision on each with a sharp knife.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	If there is doubt left, and you do not know which one it is, then you begin with the incision of the largest one, and the most obvious pus from among them.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make it look like the two veins that are on their lips.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	You may usually cut both veins that are on the lip left open.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	When both veins that are on the tongue are left open, then perform phlebotomy of the cephalic vein at its proximal parts that are in the throat, to the malady of the uvula, and to maladies of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomy for these is that it follows the disease among your fingers in front of the sun, raises the tongue, and observes under the tongue, from one side the vein and from the other side the vein, and the color of each declines towards blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then make a small incision on each one; and be careful not to cut off the arteries with your knife, as they are vital.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins, which are usually fleubotomized in the thigh, are the ones through which blood flows in all humans. The fleubotomy of these is performed in two ways: either by applying a mild cauterization with myrtle or olive oil, or by using a cut-edge fleubotomy tool, which is called a "nessil". This is the form of treatment.
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this "nessil" is what you use for cutting, and it comes in various shapes and sizes depending on the width of the veins and the tightness of their structure.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of myrtle fleubotomy:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	its width should be adjusted with the thickness of the veins, and it should open the concave, full veins that appear thick, and those containing large clots.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the technique of olive-shaped flebotomy:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	This flebotomy is of smaller diameter and has more delicate extremities, and it is suitable for the flebotomy of subtle veins that contain thin red blood.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	However, the use of flebotomy on the basil vein, one of three veins, is to remove blood from the lower limbs and abdomen, which have become stagnant due to illness.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the flebotomist, when performing that flebotomy, to be careful and cautious in that area, because if he deviates and misplaces the puncture of the flebotomy, he will cut that artery and cause a flow of blood, so it is important that he does not perform that flebotomy with a sharp instrument, but rather with an arteriotome.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the stone does not appear by clear indication, you must know that you should remove it and place another, or seek some ram of it; or incise in the place where it ends in the arm, for it is manifest; and then treat it with flebotomy as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	If you wish to perform flebotomy, note the tightness of the arm at the point where you touch the location, within which you know the place of the pulse; then place your hand over it tightly; and close the arm, and cut the vein with a concave section as we have said; and be careful not to harm the percussion for any space in the area of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you feel, with strength the ligament, an inflammation in the place that you have touched with your hand, then that inflammation is inflammation of the artery, and therefore avoid that one.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you feel the flow of blood in flebotomy as with an ear of a child, and the flow is subtile and thin, then know that it is from the artery; and immediately cut and place your finger over it for a long time; and if the flow stops, because the vessel has been severed, tighten the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And you should observe the patient from the moisture of their body, be very careful with them, and do not cause any harm to them for a few days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	If the gangrenous part cannot be severed and you do not have a suitable medicine for it, then you will have to cut into the artery if it appears necessary; for the end of the limb is contracted and the gangrene is detached; or you can use a fistula, make one, take a small portion of it, and stretch that over the place of the vein with stricture using ligatures and poultices within the next day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the gangrene is detached, then it is good; but if not, treat it with the water mentioned earlier, to the remembrance of the place of the detached powder's flow of gangrene.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the removal of the gangrene from him is difficult due to the small size of the location of the plague and the possibility of limb attachment.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But for the dark vein, phlebotomy is quickly performed to extract the blood from the upper part of the head and leave it from the lower parts of the body; for this reason it is composed of branches of the basilic vein and the cephalica, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And be cautious with the phlebotomist if there is excessive fear in performing the phlebotomy, because then it becomes a nerve; and when he finds the nerve, he must carefully avoid it during the phlebotomy, which will cause stupor, and make healing difficult, and often the patient does not recover fully. This nerve shows itself through sensation; if it is hidden in some men and is subtle and not apparent, then you must pause and reconsider performing the phlebotomy with which you are cutting off the vein, and avoid the nerve with all your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then cut the vein along its length.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The immediate effect of phlebotomy on the cephalic vein is that it draws off the blood from the head and provides relief from ailments of the feet.
