E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And therefore the broad vein is cut or the leg is elevated after the patient's position has been adjusted, as this is better and more salutary.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform a flebotomy on the foot, be careful of the nerves that are left beneath the surface of the skin, and place your hand over it when performing the flebotomy, passing along its length, as if you were going to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And the flebotomy should be successful.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	If it is forbidden to raise the leg, then immerse the foot in water and let the blood flow out until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the flebotomist misses on the first attempt, repeat the flebotomy on another small part, since the area is sensitive; and do not fear any harm as long as you protect the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And it seems to be done with the same care on the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the same area as we have said is where the foot should be placed, leaving the calf in the wild branch position.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the wound of the flebotomy on him is at the hip joint when it is done with a hot cautery.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the flebotomy on him is that the patient relaxes in the bath, and quickly and gently pulls the flesh of his leg from the inside of his ankle to above his foot with a thin, long instrument, so that only this is visible.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And so when it appears, you perform a surgical incision on that part according to each skill that is within your ability and according to the direction, which is best; either make an incision through dissection or sever it through secation, since the location of it is exposed.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	It is not uncommon; and if you find it, and it does not appear in the sensation of all, perform a surgical incision on one of its branches, and it is that which appears at the back of the foot instead of the aforementioned great toe and little finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be mindful of the nerves, and allow the blood to flow from the wound as much as you wish.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then tighten the bandage around the incision site and gently hold it in place, as rest is beneficial for healing.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventilation and the qualities of use of those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozas are made of horns, or iron, or glass.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And the treatment of ventozas (blisters) is done through two methods: one involves the incision and extraction of pus, and the other involves the application of a blister.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this blister treatment, which is through incision, is done in two ways: either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the blisters that are treated by incision and extraction of pus are in twelve locations on the body: one where blisters are paused, which is at the nape of the neck; two on each side of the spine; blisters under the jaw, below the mouth; two on each shoulder blade; blisters on the loins, just above the tailbone; two on either arm, near the elbow; and blisters on two fingers or toes.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And the extraction of the sancus should not be from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and for this reason, one does not catch the virtue through them, as it happens with phlebotomy; nor should one cover that the ventozacio is made with fire or heat in any illness caused by swelling until the body is entirely evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	If it is necessary to provoke a ventozacio (venesection) for illness or continuously, we should do so at the beginning and end of the month, and in the middle part of the day and at any other time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in men, the sancus (sickness) multiplies in those who are in need of venesection and find it difficult and painful; and from these, one finds swelling and heat on their face and head and neck, and tightness in their face and forehead and darkness and weakness in their eyes; and from these, the place of their venesection leaks; and from these, their laughter increases; and from these, they taste sancus in their mouth, or their tongue becomes attached and spits out sancus; and from these, sleep multiplies, and those who have sancus while sleeping, suffer rigor, ants, and other similar afflictions.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when it occurs in any cause of those conditions, and especially if it is in the third or middle of the month, they command ventilation to be done rather than waiting for two or three hours past the day.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the immediate relief from ventilation of the neck is that when it confers gravity on the head and what collapses in the ears, it becomes clear that this is an appropriate evacuation of all the body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is done at the site of phlebotomy of the head.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not advisable to use that which is of foul composition or in which catarrh exists, as it causes great harm to that.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for that reason, the use of those vessels is not advisable, especially in the heads where frail conditions exist.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	Make known to him who is lying on it that relief is granted; and for this reason you must order the ventilator to place his hand slightly on the parts where the suction cups are, lest there be generation of pain.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	The application of suction cups (ventozacio) is instead of phlebotomy of the deep vein and basilic: and for this reason it confers relief from asthma, constriction of the air passages, division of the air muscles, cough, and congestion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is necessary that the suction cup be applied to the alkhel (foot) slightly, for if it is left in place too long, it generates weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the application of suction cups (ventozacio) to the head confers relief from accidental pain in the head, ophthalmia (eye inflammation), migraine, and toothache; and it is instead of phlebotomy of the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And instruct the fan to not press their hand during the incision so as not to pierce the artery and cause bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	After the incision, apply alcohol to the mouth and to the corruption of the gums, resembling other diseases in the mouth, and it takes the place of phlebotomy from the veins on both lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the incision made on both cheeks provides a cure, which is done by applying heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the incision made within the fissures provides immediate relief from phlebotomy of three veins, namely the basilic, superficial, and cephalic, as those draw the blood from all the smaller, deeper veins in the flesh, as well as the finer veins from the larger ones until they reach the three mentioned veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the bellows man not to blow too strongly in the incision, for the place is stripped of flesh, and leaves its nerves and arteries exposed.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a bellows which is blown over others and confers treatment to hemorrhoids in the buttocks and to pus ulcers left behind.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And you must command the bellows man to be a strong bellows, and of iron, for the place needs a strong section; and it tolerates only powerful but gentle blowings and is incised with a sharp knife.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	The gentle bellows from the legs cause a minimal manifestation, for they draw the blood from all parts of the body, and confer relief to ancient pains from gout and kidney stones; they induce menstruation and bring comfort to pain in the bowels and bladder; and serve as an alternative to lancing of two veins, and to strangulation with rope, and two pins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, these weaknesses exhaust the entire body and cause fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the openings (ventosas) of the loin, the healing is proper to the healing of the vents of both legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the openings is that it stops the opening at the beginning of the evacuation and sucks through a gentle suction, and does not prolong the position of the openings, rather it slightly lifts some, and presses others firmly, and causes the humors to come to the area by chance.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this until you see the area turn red and swollen, and the pain of the inflammation appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	Then cut and repeat the suction little by little, and consider the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For that man who has thin, delicate skin, be sure to make an incision once and not repeat it, so the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And order the fan to amplify the scarification and apply some pressure, and facilitate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the swelling in the vein is great, be sure to scarify twice, for the first incision opens the way for the absorption of the vein and its contents.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	In the second, apply the scrutiny acquired from the extraction of the large vein.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the vein is very foul-smelling, make a third scarification so that you can achieve the last (result/process).
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	Lastly, when we want to extract the vein little by little or a small one, it is enough for us to make a single scarification.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we wish to extract a solid stone, we perform a thorough incision; and if we know that the stone is large, then we must make an extensive incision.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term "scarification" refers solely to the depth of the incision.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the incision is deep, hard, rough, and its edges are very close together, then the places for the suction cups should be smeared with a softer, wider, resolute opening; if it is in summer, with aloe oil or violet oil or crushed almond oil or henna seed oil; and if it is in winter, then with birch oil or larch oil or chamomile oil or st John's wort oil, similar substances.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess [tissue] is thick, fibrous, then use oil of amber, or balsam oil, or aloe oil, or anise oil, and similar substances.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	If the leech is of ample size and has tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and at these places where leeches are applied, the leeching should be with watery solutions, or with water fortified with solatrum, or with water from a cucumber, or with water from a grapevine, and similar substances.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that one whose leech has a very moist sanitarium, washes its leeches in wine or in water of myrtle and sumac and similar substances.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for those whose secretions are excessive, wash their leeches in old wine or in water of fennel, which is marjoram, or of decoction of anise, or chamomile, and similar substances.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And be it known that leeching should be protected from baths; it is advisable to administer the leech immediately before or after a bath for about an hour or two, and ensure it sleeps near the wound.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is it that must be done to regulate the flow of blood after phlebotomy before ventilation?
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	When beginning the treatment: if the phlebotomist or the one who has undergone flebotomy is irritable and has severe pain and inflammation, then you should take measures to cool down, such as using milky herbs, fennel, aniseed, dill, and similar plants.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And they should abstain from their meals as well, including light meats, and foods seasoned with herbs, and similar things.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for those whose condition is severe, they should take in plenty of cold water, or water from the plant althaeas with seeds, and sumac, and a drink with a strong scent between wine and honey; and it is recommended that he limit his drinking and eating, abstain from meals containing chicken, cabbage, and wine.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is important that on days of ventilation and phlebotomy, drinking should be greater than food intake.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	It is important to give alcoholic drinks to some people, such as hyssop or musk, which are muscaty, or alcelite before ventilation or phlebotomy, or afterwards, so that the principal members are comforted and the pain is alleviated; and one should not allow them to take that scalding.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	One should not perform ventilation on parts that are subject to scarification, such as the liver, and over the navel, in the places of the joints, and the opening of the anus, because these members do not tolerate scarification.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those with a strong attraction of pus from a member, thus pausing ventilation over the breast in flux of pus from the pus of the nose; and they use that to dissolve the trapped ventilation within the member, similarly pausing over the abdomen and navel; for it rarifies the member and scalds it and removes pain as it resolves ventilation.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And now rests on the wounds when it occurs in their compression or pressure, for by virtue of strong attraction, it improves the compression and eradicates the pressure from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And it seems to happen when it rests on the liver and gallbladder, requiring ventilation in those enclosed areas.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these ventilations are administered using suction, sometimes only; and in some cases, they are administered over fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes, they are administered full of heated water in the patient's gallbladder ailments.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the ventilation be filled and form pus, it is only heated water or water in which suitable herbs have been infused.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of an ampule administered by fire: the size of the orifice should be two fingers in diameter, as we have formed it; and the quantity of the liquid should be the amount that fits into a palm; and in its width, at the place where it is in the circuit, it should be half, the opening should be small according to the quantity that goes into it with an needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	Use erbs, roo or citrus, with thick slices of onion, lemon, ginger and parsley so that they do not damage the member in its position over it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And at the middle of it, a transverse slice of erb or iron, where the candle is stopped over the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this ampule is much larger than the one we have previously used; and its quantity is less, according to the illness and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the cups used for children and the weak are different from the cups used for young and robust individuals.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the method of applying this cup is to use fire from a piece of wood gently over it, and place it on the middle of the transverse ligament in the exact spot of the cup, so that the fire is lit around the edge, preventing it from burning the patient's body.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	Once applied to the patient's member, and with the position as we have described it, within a short time, when the cups are in place and do not require any further aid, the heat causes the vapor to form over that area, and the cup will soon dissolve.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And adjust the cup according to your liking, and repeat if further aid is needed.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	It is also possible to use a cup on patients with pleurisy, without the presence of a transverse ligament or a point, and it should only be filled with water and applied to the member.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this bellows, the larger it is, the better, because it can receive a great quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	**Chapter LXXVII**
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Bloodletting is not administered in all members but only in those where it is not possible to place bellows, due to their smallness, as well as the nose and similar parts; or in a member devoid of flesh, as in the case of the nose and its surroundings.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that you have found bloodletting instruments in the infected water of wounds.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Then it is appropriate to immerse the day and night in infected water, as long as they are not harmful, and do not cause any pain in the belly of those affected; and then evacuate the body at the beginning with flebotomy and bellows; and rub the patient's member until it becomes red; and place a cushion on them.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are filled and closed.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to drain the area with a ventosa, it is more effective in youth.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	If not, wash the area with wine mixed with vinegar and then apply a lot of hot water; it should be rubbed and pressed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the duration of the bandage prevents the draining of blood vessels, and it is necessary to absorb the sweat, then place a cloth soaked in cold water on top and secure it so that the sweating stops.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bandage becomes multiplied, then sprinkle over it powdered vitriol mixed with gall and similar substances to the stiptics, as long as the bandage is absorbed; or place pauses on the area with crushed fava beans, and lay them down until the beans adhere to the area, and the bandage is absorbed.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And if, it is necessary, apply bloodletting, when possible change those.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if bloodletting is contraindicated, then the place should be rubbed with a hot compress or left with a needle in the spot until it bleeds; and when they are stopped, since those who feel any pain will soon release it.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to open, sprinkle over those a little aloe tristrate, or salt, or ash, and it will soon open.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the process of recovery from the third stage: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is often necessary in the art of medicine; it is the restoration of fractures and dislocations in bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, son, know that those who boast of this chapter are foolish doctors and the common people, and those who do not study or read the books of the Ancients even for a little while.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, it happens that this way of thinking among scientists in our land is lacking; and you should never forget this at all; I have not dedicated myself to this task except for a long time studying the books of the Ancients and reflecting on their understanding, so as to extract science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I have dedicated my life to experimentation and study.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have here described in this chapter everything that relates to my science and upon which I have conducted my experiments; so that those who are busy with lengthening may shorten it for themselves and be relieved of its occupation; and I have shortened it at the end of explanation; and I have demonstrated it at the end of declaration; and I have formed in it motifs from the tools that are administered there, as is done by addition of declaration, just as I have done in the two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	First chapter.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	In summary, and as a collection of fractures of the bones, those whose previous mention is necessary before we begin the remembrance of fractured limbs and various conditions of each.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us begin with the summary of this chapter, outlining the essence of the discourse; and the chapters that follow, which are for the understanding of the artificer, at leisure and focused on the truth of these matters; to you and those who are eager to learn this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	And therefore, it is said that when you encounter a fracture or dislocation or twisting or injury, you should immediately consider starting with fleubotomy or separating it, or sometimes, if no other cause prohibits, by the elimination of virtue, or as the case may be, whether it is in a state of decay, or there is a time of intense heat, or intense friction.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then I am content with food consisting of herbs, veal and crab meat; I forbid fatty meats and filling myself with foods that clog the veins with lye, as long as you are careful to avoid gangrene, and if you do not fear the emission of matter into the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their original condition, from which they usually recover.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And so when the bone has begun to heal, you must ensure that the patient is fed nourishing foods with plenty of moisture, such as cooked wheat with water, rice, bread, meat, veal, fresh fish, and similar foods, and at this stage the goal is to promote the coagulation of the fracture more gently and slowly.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And you should know that the bones break when they are in the hands of men, both in the first violence and in the decrepit, it is not possible for them to continue and be consolidated according to their nature due to the drying out of their members.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And they are consolidated and continued according to their nature for as long as those members are desiccated, and they are continued and consolidated those that are of their own nature at the end of the lethargy, just as the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature itself adjusts and amends the broken bone from any cause similar to gout, in which there is swelling that adheres and strengthens that part which is always glued and joined together, until the end of strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning, nor does any cause forbid it from its works.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to restrict the patient's food, food in which there is gravity and viscosity and thickness, as we have said.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	The diversity of fractures varies according to the diversity of members.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And you should know that the species of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of members, for the fracture of a bone in the leg is different from the fracture of a bone in the head; and the fracture of a bone in the foot is diverse from the fracture of a bone in the arm; and similarly, all other members are diverse among themselves.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And now let us recall all kinds of fractures, exposed in their separate chapters.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	A great variety of fractures, indeed.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And there are diverse species of bone fractures in their nature; for some are arcoated fractures or those that occur in them like stars; and sometimes they are fractured according to the length of the bone: these are the sagittal, stellate, and other fractures, both occurring and not occurring from a blow, as is done when preparing to write, and the fracture by plague and dislocation in the skull, and the small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each species has its own peculiar pain and torment in restoration according to the distinct memory of its place.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	A clear sign of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And this is how it is known to be a broken bone: its twisting, and that prominence and sensation of it in the touch, only when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And therefore if there is no appearance of twisting in the location and there is no great pain felt when touching the bone due to its agitation, then it is not a fracture here.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	It is possible that it is a twist or small fracture, where you do not feel pain when pressing with your hand and there is no great compression; then apply over it the medicines of which you have recollection appropriate to that moment which convenes to the location; and then make it very tight due to subtle tightness.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And you know that the location when it is arched and does not split into two or another thing that does not happen in it gradually, as soon as the whole part of its comparison is torn, then you must begin from your hour to rectify it before it becomes infected.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if it becomes infected with gangrene, leave it for a few days until the gangrene disappears; then apply it in any way that seems appropriate and effective.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	And you know that the restoration of the flesh and the stitching of it is easier than the treatment of bone where damage has occurred.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Then strengthen it according to the recall of the flesh.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	If there are severe fractures in the bones, it is necessary to extend this broken member from two parts, whether it is the hand or the foot; or use your hand if the member is small; or tie two strings or one string and the hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And position the member in a way that is similar to its natural state while maintaining the stretched parts of the broken member; then perforate to ensure those additions return to their places, using any means and methods you can.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	And be careful, according to your strength, that you do not act on the patient through your painful operation or injury; and pierce yourself according to your ability, applying one tool to another in its best form.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And be sure to touch with your hand at the right time, and if you notice any other cause, correct it and heal it with the amount of your virtue.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid severe stretching and compression, as foolish doctors often cause gangrene with their operations, or they cause contraction in the member, as we have seen this happening through the operations of their fanciful motions.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	And then attach, apply correct positioning and careful operation to that member, provide rest and tranquility; caution the patient over this and make him/her avoid any strain on that in the hours of his/her watchfulness and sleep, and observe its revolution and agitation, and take care of its management, and take into account all of its movements with all your strength; wait until you know the position of the member is a position secured from pain, which is the cause when one feels it in the disposition of the member's position, causing pain or injury; at this time, be aware that you change its position to another where no pain is felt; and watch over this so that the position of it remains straight and balanced, so that no deformity occurs in it when it is restored.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	And the quality of the constriction of the member at rest is what you should consider, because you must know that the members broken are diversified in their smallness and greatness and in the shape of those.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And of those that are small like the arm and the elbow and similar to those, you must understand that the envelopment should be of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those that are thick like the skin or the leg, you must understand that in these there should be a complete and hard envelopment, because the tightness around each part connects the large member and makes it strong from every side, so that nothing enters inside.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	And then begin, carefully discharge your feces, place a suitable poultice on it, over the place of that fracture with three or four layers according to the member, and tighten your hand slightly on the poultice.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And then carefully remove the splint from the most dominant part of the fracture site, and stretch it gently so as not to tighten your restriction, which you have strengthened at the fracture site.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	And then gradually lengthen the wrap around the fracture site, and gently ease the restriction little by little, until you achieve a considerable opening at the site.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Then take another bandage and wrap it around the twisted area, covering it with the previous bandage as far as possible beyond the fracture; and now your operation is on the restriction of the bandages and their gentle easing according to what we have said about the first bandage.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Then place a stopple or cloth between the bandages to support the curvature of the fracture if it is curved; otherwise, do not place anything in it for no reason.
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	And then place your hand over the other area, and cover these sterile bandages made properly around it, if there is no inflammation or abscess present, and apply pressure to where the abscess is and where you feel the inflammation; leave it for a few days, and then tighten the bandages.
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	And the bandages should be of different types of canvas, carefully made; or of wood; or of palm leaves; and their width should be according to this form and figure.
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	However, it is necessary that the bandage placed over the fracture be thicker and longer than the others, and its length according to the measurement of the member in magnitude and smallness; then tighten the bandages over the other area according to your initial tension; and wrap them closely around with a thread decently as we have said about tension, and it should be your tension according to the location of the fracture more, and the longer it extends from the fracture, the tighter the tension.
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And take care that the threads are stronger in thickness and fineness, and that they be many; and if the threads are thick, as you have seen in the operation of some tissues that pause the threads of their cords from the twist, it is a great error when the tightness becomes equal.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	Indeed, very fine threads are not suitable, because you will not be able to achieve the desired tightness with them, and you will not realize that between one thread and another there is less than a finger's width.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	And if the disease is located at the ends of the bones, then tighten them in these places without applying excessive pressure, so that it does not cause harm to the soft tissues or a bruise.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes, fracture is the plague, and it causes disruption in the ligament, leading to a recurrence in that area as specified in the second chapter due to its particular nature.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	And you should know that a completely severed member is not immediately bound with steels on the first day; this is because when the member is large, it cannot be pinned down by steels until several days later, or perhaps seven or fifteen, depending on your confidence in preventing gangrene from setting in.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	And this is the manner of splints used by the ancients to restore, which are placed over fractures and dislocations and twists.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Method of splinting as an accelerated means of restoring a fracture, most suitable for complex cases and especially for women and children, where heat or friction should not be applied: take flour from the mill, which is the heart of the grain that prevents the movement of the millstones against the walls.
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	And if that does not work as such, then take a thin and soft cloth, and prepare it not too thick or thin, and apply it accordingly.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Another method of plastering to restore fractures and dislocations and twists: prepare assafetida, labdanum, acacia, enula, and migra, which is grated from milker's salvage, from all parts of the dragon. 5; myrrh and aloe from the dragon. 2; alcohol from the dragon. 10; all these are triturated and mixed with alichil water or egg albumen if the patient's condition is scorched; then apply this plaster, as it is of good composition and restores broken bones slightly, and confers benefit to many men.
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another plaster method that confers benefit to fractures and twists: prepare migra and add white alder, from the dragon 10 times; myrrh and aloe, each from the dragon 5 times; acacia, from the dragon 6 times; and Armenian bole, from the dragon 20 times.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	All these are triturated in a mortar with strong pressure, and then sieved, mixed with water or egg albumen and administered.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	A method of plastering joints and bones to separate them from their places, causing accidental pain in those and in cracks and fractures; take fine wool and submerge it in a mixture of wine and oil, and place it over the area.

A method of quick-acting plaster applied for the restoration of broken bones and when you desire a resolution from an abscess: take roots of althae, chamomile flowers, violet flowers, whole wheat flour, all finely ground; mix them together with wine, if the member is not scorched.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	If it is scalded, then apply that with cool water from parsley or with water and use it.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another method of applying a strong poultice for resolution after the initial one, when there is a hard apothema, is to prepare a mixture of fennel seeds and licorice root, and also of balm, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile flowers, any other herbs, all finely chopped and mixed with either savory water, or diluted water, or wine, according to the quality of the member and the rest of its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates does not specify in his work that it should be placed over the affected member before its restoration, unless certain preparations of wax and oil are made, and not otherwise; he recommends that it should be applied with a balance between thickness and thinness.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	Galen also states that poultices should be applied to the broken member after its restoration, and the causes for their drying require heat, such as with myrrh, onions, and similar herbs, in the same way as for those causes that we have recommended.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A method of applying a plaster for injury and pain: take half a pound of lint, horsehair from an animal's mane or feathers from a bird, and other materials, mix them together, grind them, sift them, and prepare the plaster.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	The amount should be adjusted according to the size of the wound and if it is completely separated, consider whether there is no pain or discomfort or if the bone is not broken; in this case, do not attempt to separate the bones immediately.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu. E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a piece of linen and sponge from the sea, soak it in hot water, and apply this to the area until the pressure and pain cease; then allow the member to rest for an hour. Next, cover it with woolen cloth soaked in vinegar or rose oil, and wrap it up; leave it in this state for the night, ensuring there is no risk of infection and that the swelling subsides, alleviating the pain in the member.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then repeat that precise procedure, applying a thin restraint with a small plaster and not tightening it too much with your initial constraint, but gently apply it to whatever needs healing.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	And if the abscess, inflammation, pain, and all other symptoms have already subsided, and you find yourself in need of a plaster and restraints, then repeat that same procedure as you began with the initial treatment.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	And if no cause for these symptoms (as we have mentioned) occurs in the member, then do not drain it unless after three or four or five or seven days; and sometimes everything is left for twenty days, as you see fit from the loosening of the member, as we have said, until the fracture adheres and approaches the coagulation of the flesh on that spot.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then adjust the restraints more than your initial restraints, and also adjust the diet of the patient according to their condition's improvement.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you examine the site of the fracture and find it already dried and weakened but not covered, then know that nourishment is prohibited from reaching it; so you should immerse it in hot water every time you take care of it; and do this for three days; and little by little relieve the tightness, and through this operation direct the nourishment to the member, and heal it gently.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	But what the ignorant restorers of a member fracture do another time when it is not restored at the beginning, according to how it is covered, and is restored according to its twists, is an error according to their operation, and causes great fear, and if it were a skilled surgeon, he would enlarge the ancient wounds in their free spaces and heal them toward this.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And you have not seen any of them do this, so it is all the more reasonable that this should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	**Section: On Fractures When They Occur in the Head.**
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	The fragments of fractures are diverse, and their shapes vary, and the causes are distinct, for some fractures are caused by the impact of a blow, which arrests all the bone within the flesh, leaving the bone thus as it was in the fist, and that is why this type is called simple; or the space cuts through a portion of the bone, cuts the flesh thereof, and does not permit the incision to pass through the rear part of the bone; and this type of fracture is called complete.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	And the affliction of these two types of fractures is either great or slight, and it can be caused by pressure or impact upon a bone; their appearance is similar.
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	And this fracture is either penetrating, approaching the tissue that surrounds the bone, or it is on the surface of the bone; and the affliction of these two types of fractures can be great or slight.
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	And this fracture is confined to the bone in the delicate part of the hair follicle, and that is why this type of fracture is called capillary.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	And if a fracture is caused either by an accident or by the impact of a stone and appears similar, causing some lamina of bone to enter the space inside, it is experienced in the concavity of the location just as it happens with the ribs when they are struck and it is the exit of their entrance into the internal space.
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And it is primarily caused in the bones of the joints, just as it is in the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And all these types of fractures, being separated, are painful just like stars dispersed.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And one should return to memory of all this in its place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I would recognize all these types of fractures by detecting them and through the inquiry of their attempts and the evident corruption of flesh upon them.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	And a special capillary is known for what is discovered over the bone, it is washed, and cleaned upon it with tenet, because the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	In the treatment of fractures, one must consider from the beginning the accidents of the illness, and if you examine the accidents by their signs that manifest themselves as pain, vomiting of colic, extension, loss of understanding, absence of voice, fainting, acute fever, and the appearance of ulcers and bleeding from those, and similar to them in the major dispositions, then it is clear that one is not healed.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	And if you observe unusual accidents, you hope for health, then you begin the treatment of it.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	Which causes, because if the plague comes to you at the beginning as it comes and this happens during the winter, then know that you must study the skeleton of the bone from the 13th day according to all dispositions.
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	And if it is during the summer days, you must ensure that you cover the bone against direct sunlight after six days, as what remains of the skin will be corrupted by fat, and accidents that we have mentioned may occur.
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	And if the fracture has already penetrated into the fatty tissue, covering the brain, and it is in small pieces and inflammation, you must then cut out the damaged and inflamed part, as I have mentioned before.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	And it is that you must examine the patient's head for the plague, and discover over the bone according to custom and method, as possible according to the figure of the plague, and it should be lighter on the patient.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	And if you encounter a bone infection, pus or abscess, you must oppose it with what is appropriate, and it is that you fill the area with bandages soaked in vinegar and rose oil, and let the plague rest until the abscess subsides, and be certain of the flow of pus; and then begin at the circumference of the bone and in the removal of it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	And this is according to one of two methods of operation.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And one method is that you insert the bone knife at an angle, and this is the shape of it: Then apply another knife to this, slightly wider than the first; and this is the shape of it:
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Then apply the knife more widely than the second one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	And you must choose the number of knives according to need, some being wider than others; and some shorter, the latter having a sharper point at their tip, made of iron or steel.
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use them with ease in percussion over the knife to avoid damaging its tip and that of the patient.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong, hard, you must perforate in a circular motion around it before administering the scissors to the incisions, which are called non-penetrating incisions.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus, but rather because they do not allow the term of the bone in the testis to be placed to it, so that at the edge or margin of the incision is a round extreme or edge over which the head of the bone does not protrude, resembling a small margin or circle, which prevents submersion and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take from these incisions a great number of which each one corresponds to the specificity of each bone, as long as you are present in all parts of the skull, the end of which is acute, the amount in length and brevity is according to the quantity of specificity of this test.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	This is the method for three types of incisions: The quality of perforating in the circle around the broken bone is to place the incision over the bone and turn it with your fingers until you know that the bone is penetrated; then, change the incision to another location and stop when the amount of thickness of the ray or surrounding area is passed.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	And then cut with scissors what is between any two bones, and make that small hole over it in a levitative manner, as we have said, so as to remove the bone, or with your hand, or with any other cause using some tools you have prepared for this purpose, with forceps and other delicate instruments.
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And beware that you handle with all caution so that the scissors do not touch any part of the patient's body.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	And so when you have pierced the bone and it is separated from the tissue if it continues to be attached, take that extract, beware of scratching and biting it on the roughness of the bone with some instrument resembling scissors, but nevertheless ensure it is more gentle and subtler than the other scissors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if you notice any movement of the small and fragile bones, then take advantage of this with the instruments at your disposal, and apply it to cure the wound with liniment and ointment as we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	And another method of operation is light, free from pain, which dissects bone and flesh with great praise; this is the speech of it: It is necessary for you at the beginning that you begin to uncover the part of the bone in the place where the fracture is most violent and evident, until when you have uncovered that part and paused, leave there the extreme of this slow and gentle incision from which this form comes.
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os.	And the slow part is round and does not cut any cause, but the sharp part is in two cuts ahead in length, so when you have opened the slow part, adjust it to the shape of the sharp incision facing it on the bone.
E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment.
