Then strike the incision of one part with a small hammer until it cuts through the bone entirely, thus making it easier to turn, and be sure of the position of the panniculus so that no accident occurs in any way, and if the medicant14 was the most foolish of all men and the most ignorant of their conditions; certainly, he was asleep.
Lahoras si romania alcuna causa annexa al os del pannicol en alcus locs de os, inscidira aquel de lu am la extremitat del inscissori aquel lenticular, e deliuraria aquel de lu am facilitat, quar es deliurat de lu ses nocument e ses paor.	When a bone breaks due to some cause attached to the panniculus (fatty tissue) in certain places of the bone, it should be cut with a scalpel at that part closest to the blade, and easily separated, as it is freed from its discomfort and pain.
E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquela asperitat e erradiques aquelas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.	If the bone fracture does not penetrate into the panniculus, and what is detached or left attached to the bone is the fascia, which has roughness and subtle fibers, you should shave off that roughness and eliminate those fibers with finely sharpened razors that you have prepared in various quantities, so that it is possible for you to apply them in all areas as most appropriate during your operation on the fractured bone and according to the shape it has assumed.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	And you should be mindful in your reasoning as to which razors to use at the beginning, applying the thinnest ones first and then using thicker ones as needed, without stopping until you have administered the most suitable and thinnest ones to all areas.
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	Place a small capillary and delicate fracture into each of the other breaks, ensuring you administer treatment according to what you find in correcting them.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And it is because not all those who have studied this art practice it fully.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And we have shown, regarding what he writes, the application in great fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	And if the pannus (or skin) is stretched when you dislocate a bone, then take cloth from it according to the extent of the damage, immerse that in warm oil and place it over the affected area; then take another piece of cloth, either folded twice or thrice, immerse that in vinegar and water, and place it on top of the first cloth, gently pressing it so as not to aggravate the wound; and finally, apply a dressing of lard, not tightening it, but allowing it to cover the affected area.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	And leave this treatment for a day or two until you are sure of the fever's abatement; then remove that and administer medications as needed, such as raisin juice, flour of eggs, powder of herbs and aristology, and similar things.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And you should make this medicine into a powder that is sprinkled on the affected area, when it is dry; and generally, administer to that person all medicines of the right kind from which he or she abstains and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	And be mindful according to your virtue that the plague in your treatment be clean; and do not use ointments or other things; nor should you add virulence to it; for when it is placed on the membranous covering of the brain, it corrupts that and destroys it, and brings about a malicious malignancy over the disease.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And it happens in the brain, when due to its purification the bones are affected and even more so when the treatment of it is delayed, and it becomes black on its surface; and therefore consider whether, in the case of the disease, such accidents occur as we have mentioned, knowing that these are harmful to all skills.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not experience the dark color (gout) only from the medicine placed upon it, but it is due to that very medicine, then take some honey and crushed olive oil in equal parts, and wrap them around the affected area; then apply a poultice with appropriate remedies for healing until it is cured.
Capitol .iii.	**Capitol III.**
De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken.
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	You know that the nose is not broken in one place but rather in two superior parts or sometimes in one of those small bones, so that it has two bones in it, because the fracture leaves it cartilaginous, not broken and it does not occur to it but rather atrophy, tortuosity and sinusitis.
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	If one of the two parts is broken, then you must insert a small piece into his nose, and hold that fracture inside with your finger, and also push it from outside, so that the nose returns to its natural shape.
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And do this for your convenience, and be careful not to cause pain during your operation on the patient's illness.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	And if the fracture is in the superior part of the nose and does not reach that part, then you must equalize the end of the ray where the thickening has occurred.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture is in two parts, then you do the same to it.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	And on the first day of the fracture, attempt to restore it if possible; otherwise, return to the original position cautiously after seven or eight days of rest.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	And insert a piece of cloth from the linen into the nostril, if the fracture is in one part, or use two pieces, if the fracture is in two parts, making them as thick as possible to fill the nasal cavity.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	And some of the ancient healers would insert the pieces in a moistened border, and change them daily, which I have not seen; instead, they would place the piece in raw egg albumen with flour powder; and leave it until the bone is healed and the cartilage hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	And in some cases, it becomes entangled in the nose, in place of any cold, causing severe pain because it is wrapped in lion's cloth; and if you have already broken the nose severely and the pain does not prevent inspiration.
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	And this cause is not necessary; and if you wish, do it, and if you wish, use cold applications.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if, after another application of the cautery, gangrene occurs, apply a paste to the nose made of beeswax and honey mixed with vinegar or distilled water.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	If gangrene does not occur after the cautery, cover it with a paste made of sesame flour and powdered hen's eggs mixed with egg white, and place your hand over it to prevent any further infection.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	But if the bones of the nose are broken or fractured in any way or there is a crack, then you must carefully extract them using suitable instruments; and then close the wound with stitches, and treat it with what is appropriate to heal and consolidate it, and apply suitable plasters.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if a plague occurs within the nose, then you must treat it with caution and insert silver tubes until it is completely healed.
Capitol .iiii.	**Capitol IV**
De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	**On the Restoration of the Mandible When Broken**
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jawbone is broken and the fracture is not accompanied by severe pain, observe whether the fracture is only on one side, and not split into two parts, but curved at the site of the break. In such cases, its healing is slight.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And therefore, if the fracture is on the right side, you must insert your little finger of the left hand into the patient's mouth to support it; and conversely, if the fracture is on the left mandible, then insert your right little finger from the outside, pushing gently to facilitate the alignment of the broken parts from within, while maintaining an even pressure with your other hand from the outside.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	And if the fracture of the jaw is already separated into two parts, then you must administer extension to both parts according to their correct alignment so that its equilibrium can be achieved.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there is a concussion of the teeth due to displacement, then tighten those which you hope will remain attached with threads of gold or silver or silk; and apply pressure over the broken mandible with wax, and place a doubled cloth over it, and a large star-shaped piece of cloth cut appropriately, or a single piece matching the length of the mandible; and fasten it to her according to your equipment for the ligation, as long as it is not destroyed.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	And order the patient to rest and be at ease, and refrain from eating heavy or spicy foods.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	And if you estimate that the shape has already been altered in some way, then after three days, re-align what has been distorted and apply a powder from a mill, or white of an egg, or flour of chamomile, since you will have kept the bandage on it, and place a warm compress over it.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And then, once this annex and the application are in place and the arrangement of the bone is not altered, leave it until it heals and strengthens the fracture; for usually this fracture tightens in three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another apotheosis (infection) occurs after the application, then administer what we have said concerning its treatment until it heals, and heal that infection.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is a serious one, consider whether it is a separation of bone or dislocation, then you must carefully hold those dislocations with what seems appropriate in the removal of those from the tools.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And if the orifice of the fracture is narrow, then you should widen it through fléubotomy according to your need.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	And then, once you have held those dislocations and it is not healed again, open the orifice of the fracture if it is narrow; otherwise, place a padding over it with one of the applications that seem appropriate until it heals.
Capitol .v.	Chapter Five.
De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On the restoration of the fork when it is broken.
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	When the fork (or bone) breaks due to a strike, it can occur in one of three ways.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Depending on whether it is broken, separated, or broken into two parts that do not accidentally cause additional damage; it is harder to restore it; or it occurs with complications, making restoration difficult; or the fracture is like a plague.
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	And for that operation, when the fracture is with complications, you should have two assistants; one should hold the broken fork and assist, while another extends the leg to stabilize it.
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then apply a splint to the fracture, keeping it straight and forming it according to its shape, without any prominence or concave areas.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	If you need a larger extension, notice where the patient's discomfort begins and place a roll of linen or woolen cloth there, as large as necessary; then extend and raise the splint and secure it with your hand while applying the splint to the fracture according to its shape.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	And if you cannot reach the end of the splint to secure it outside, because it has reached its limit, then place the patient's discomfort on their neck and rest it upon a half-sized cushion over the affected muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	The assistant should massage the affected muscle while holding the splint in place until the bone of the fracture is raised and secure; then correct the fracture and apply a splint to it with your hands.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	If you feel stiffness in the furcula (hyoid bone) and it is painful, then know that you must cut into it and extract those stiffened parts with ease.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if it is retained in the bone, then use your surgical knife from among those you have prepared for this purpose, since you had left the furcula with the instrument that serves to cut; and this is the form of the instrument: a saw or a steel blade.
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it is similar to a chisel, of which this is the concave part; and its size according to what you need it for, according to the size of the bone or the thickness of it.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	You can adjust the length of it according to what is possible for the operation; it should have two ends, with one wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the disruption of the wound which you have incised when extracting the sagacity from the bone is wide, and it is assuredly safe from infection, then you adjust both lips of the wound to close it with suture.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	And if the disruption is slight, or you fear a dangerous infection, then you employ the wound with drapes and powders according to the extent of the wound's incision.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	And if an abscess forms, then insert cloth soaked in hot oil and vinegar, and place it over that area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	When the hardness of bone at the site of the wound and its section is such that you apply a paste made from flour ground fine as albumen of egg, and place it on the surface of the wound, then stop it with lion's dung, and below that, sprinkle the dust of frankincense, if needed for that purpose, and take horsehair, which is what the Saracens use; it should be long and thick, and have a width of about a palm or so around the area; and then sprinkle double layers of powder on the wound and the paste; and take a thin table knife whose length and width are roughly three fingers, and wrap that in cloth, and wrap that cloth around the knife in place over the fracture; and when turned upside down, and revolved on the neck of the fracture and its surrounding area, and reduced to a compact mass, and as often as needed until the hardness of the fracture with its surroundings subsides, and this is what remains uncovered on you.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And as long as the star (cast) above the broken bone is not damaged; and so that you may see the malady each day, when the ligament softens or you notice the star already damaged, then correct it and tighten the bandage.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Then suspend the patient's sleep on their side, and place a small cushion under them to keep the pressure off their sleep at night; so that by that means the supporters of their body from that side are raised, and thus the fracture of the furcula is elevated from the muscle; or, alternatively, their arm is bent at the elbow.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not loosen the ligament unless it occurs at the site of the fracture or abscess within twelve days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then renew the bandage if you see that it is falling off, tighten the compression and restore it, and leave it until it is healed and the fracture of the furcula is coagulated.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is tightened and supported according to its healing stage in 28 days, and sometimes in certain cases it is cured in less time for some people.
Capitol .vi.	**Chapter VI**
De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	**On the Restoration of Shoulder Fractures**
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	The blade of the spatula is broken in its lateral part, but not the entire bone, only its margins.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And therefore, when the bone is broken, and it is broken in the middle part of itself, and it is not known except by touch, then according to how the fracture's figure protrudes, you shall prepare it and reduce it back to its natural shape in every way with the aid of your skill.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then, place a thin sheet of cloth over the area, and apply powdered chalk from a mortar; also, use a small amount of stop (a medicinal substance) or a duplicate cloth bandage; and finally, place a side table cloth subtly beneath it according to the size of the spatula.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	If the sheet is concave in any part of the spatula, then you should fill that concavity with a thick substance to even out the surface.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	And then tighten it strongly with the tongue, using constriction and the firmness of the sheet until it does not move from its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the moisture daily; whenever it becomes softened, apply again and tighten or equalize the sheet if it moves from its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And keep the patient on their side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	And the spatula should be restored in X days or in 25th (part of a day, indicating a period of time).
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And therefore when this number of days is completed, you will dissolve the bandage, and be sure that it is from the bones whose beginning was not feared nor their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you proceed from the location of the infected bone and place a chain there, then split it open and hold it fast, and act as we have said about the fracture of the tailbone cautery if this happens here.
Capitol .vii.	**Chapter VII**
De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	**On the Restoration of a Broken Foot**
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	A broken foot sometimes snaps in the middle, and it takes time to heal; more often, its ends are fractured and bruised.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And one of the accidents when the middle part breaks is that it bends inward and causes great pain, difficulty in moving, coughing, and severe vomiting; it is evident in the hollow of the broken bone and is not hidden from sensation.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And the restoration of it is that the patient be placed on their back, and a cushion be placed between their shoulders; then press upon their muscles, adjust their ribs to the two ribs, and be delicate in the operation of it and in the placement according to every manner that is possible and suitable for it, so that the shape of the bone returns as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.	Then apply a plaster and stopgap using a thin sheet of cotton or linen, similar in texture to cloth; carefully wrap this around the broken bone, gently applying pressure as needed; occasionally adjust the bandage to maintain its curve along the spine, and tighten it with moderate tension; constantly assess the bandage, and when softened, tighten it.
E si necessitat provoca a desliament de aquela deves corrossio o pruziment, o dolor, o apostema que accideysso en le loc, lahoras tu coyta e deslia aquela e erradica le emplastre e rectifique aquo que accideys per aquo am manieyra de curacio de lu; e aprop reduzeys le emplastre, si vezes ad aquo la facia; e ajusta a lu strictura entro que sia sanat.	If it becomes necessary to cause the displacement of any corrosion, inflammation, pain, or abscess that occurs in the area, then you should loosen and remove the bandage, eradicate the plaster, and correct what has occurred through the cure of it; reduce the bandage if you made it too tight; adjust its tension until healing is achieved.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter VIII.
De restauracio de las costas quan son trincadas.	On the restoration of broken ribs.
Sapias que fractura de las costas no catz sino en locs grosses que siegon le dos; e de las extremitatz de lor de la partida denant no accideys ad aquelas contricio sino per aquo quar so cartillaginosas.	You know that a fracture of the ribs does not occur lightly but in severe blows to the back; and the ends of their joints, when separated, do not cause immediate pain to those parts, since they are cartilaginous.
E cognicio de lu no es amaguada al sentiment deves la inquisicio de lu am les ditz.	And the knowledge of him is not obscured from feeling, you must inquire about his pain in these parts.
E la restauracio sia ayssi que enguales la fractura am les ditz segon la manieyra possibla, entro que sia engulhat segon que cove, e aprop emplastre e strenh le os trencat am stela, si indigeys de aquel.	And the restoration is such that it heals the fracture in these parts according to the manner possible, as it is swallowed according to what fits, and then apply a plaster and tighten the broken bone with a splint, if necessary for that.
E si la fractura de las costas es declinant a las partidas dedintz, lahoras accideys al malaute dolor vehement e punctura, ayssi cum punctura que accideys ad aquel que ha pleureci, e per aquo quar le os ponh le velament; e accideys a lu difficultat de hanelit, e tos, e vomit de mot sanc; e aquesta es de dificil curacio.	If the fracture of the ribs is inclined towards the inner parts, it causes the patient severe pain and stabbing, just as much as the stabbing that occurs in those who have pleurisy, and because of this the bone presses upon the viscera; and it causes difficulty in breathing, coughing, and vomiting of foul-smelling sputum; and this is a difficult cure.
E ja les Antixs so engeniatz en aquela am motz engientz.	And ancient remedies are ingeniously designed for that strange disease.
E de lor so que diso: cove que pauses viandas del malaute que engendro imflacio e ventositat, per que le ventre sia imflat e sia extendut, e la fractura sia impellida a las partidas defora.	And about these things they say: cover that which prevents food from the illness that generates inflammation and swelling, so that the belly is inflated and extended, and the rupture is forced out of place.
Mays nos avoreyssem aquo per so que no sia causa leugiera a generar apostema caut, si no accideys; e si ja accideys, lahoras ja ajuda ad aquo.	We would advise this to prevent any light-hearted cause generating a severe abscess, if it does not occur; and if it does occur, then aid should be given immediately.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia pausada desus ventoza e aprop que sucque am fortitut; e es semblant a ratiocinacio, mays empero es temut que la ventoza atire las superfluitatz al loc per la debilitat.	They also said that certain remedies should be applied to the affected area to reduce swelling and then suck out the excess fluid; it seems reasonable, yet there is fear that the swelling may push the excess fluid back into the affected area due to weakness.
E diyssero alcus de lor: cove que·l loc sia cubert am lana que ja es submersa en oli caut, e sian pausatz pulvils entre las costas entro que sia umplida, que sia la liadura engual quan envolopas aquela segon retonditat; e aprop sia curat le malaute am curacio de pleuresi de vianda e de medicina.	They also said: cover the affected area with cloth that has been soaked in hot oil cauterization, and place powders between the ribs until it is filled, making sure the bandage conforms to the shape; and it is thus treated for illness through pleurisy of food and medicine.
E si causa vehement constrenh le malaute la qual no sufferta, e le os punh le velament am punctura ledent, temem sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que fendam sobre le loc, descubram de la costa trencada, e aprop pausem desobre aquela instrument que conserve le ciphac, la rememoracio del qual es precedida, e que inscidam le os am facilitat, e extraguam aquel.	And if the disease causes severe constriction that cannot be endured, and the bone is pierced with a sharp point, then fear for the disease, cover it with a bandage, uncover the broken rib, and apply pressure over that instrument that preserves the integrity, the memory of which is preceded, and cut the bone to facilitate extraction.
E aprop que ajustem las doas labias de la plagua, si es gran, am cozidura, e curem aquela am emplastres entro que sia sanada.	And it is appropriate to adjust the two lips of the wound if it is large, using surgery, and treat it with dressings until it heals.
E si accideys dedintz apostema, lahoras tu coyta e enfon pulvils en oli rozat e pausa sobre le loc, e que sia curat le malaute am aquo que cove a la apostema dedintz.	And if there is an abscess inside, you cut it open and insert powders in olive oil and apply it over the area, so that the disease is cured from within the abscess.
E sia ressupinat sobre le latz sobre le qual dorm, entro que sia sanat.	And it is advisable to raise the side on which he sleeps, until it is healed.
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX.
De restauracio de fractura del spondil del dos e del col.	On the restoration of the fractured spine of the back and neck.
Alcunas veguadas endeve fractura als osses del col, e tart endeve a lor atricio, e semblantment als spondils del dos.	Sometimes, the bones of the neck can be fractured and their cartilage damaged, resembling the fractures of the spine in the back.
E cum aquo accideys ad alcu e voles saber si sara sanat o no, lahoras considera, quar si vezes las sieuas mas ja mollificadas e stupefaytas e mortas e no pot maure aquelas ni extendre ni strenher aquelas e quan constrenges aquelas am les tieus ditz o punges aquelas am agulha e no sent en aquelas dolor, lahoras sapias que no es sanat, e en las mes de disposicios es mortal.	And if this happens to anyone and you want to know if it will heal or not, consider that if their muscles are already softened, stunned, and dead, and they cannot move them nor stretch them or tighten them, and when you press on them with your fingers or pierce them with a needle, they do not hurt, then you know that it will not heal, and in the same conditions, it is deadly.
E si mau aquelas e sent en aquelas constriccio am les ditz e punctura, lahoras sapias que la nucha de l’os es salva e que le malaute guereys am curacio.	And if you feel pain in the area of the fracture and pressure or piercing, then know that the inner part of the bone is safe, and the injury will heal with treatment.
E si ve als spondils del col le semblant ad aquo e voles saber si sira sanat o no, lahoras considera als pes de lu.	And if you see the spine in the neck resembling this and want to know if it will heal, consider its weight.
Lahoras si tu vezes que so ja mollificatz, accideys ad aquels aquo que es accidit en las mas, e aprop quan jatz sobre le sieu dos, yeys ventozitat e egestio ses la sua volontat, e alcunas veguadas es resupinat sobre le sieu dos e vol urinar e no pot, lahoras sapias que es mortal, e adonc no trebales en la curacio de lu.	When you notice that the stiffness has already been reduced, pay attention to those affected parts, and when you lie on your side, they gain flexibility and mobility according to their will; sometimes they rise up on their sides and want to urinate but cannot, then you know it is a serious condition, and therefore do not attempt to treat them.
Mays si no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, la causa es milhor e pus leugiera.	If no cause of those occurs, the cause is better and more easily resolved.
E la curacio de lu es que te perforses a la sedacio del apostema caut que pauses sobre le spondil atrissat oli rozat sol, o am mugols de huous asatz; pausa sobre aquela aquel alcunas veguadas le dia entro que sia sedat le apostema caut.	And the treatment for it is to make incisions at the relaxation of the spine with a hot cautery or oil, or use poultices of vinegar; place that on the affected area several times a day until the pain in the cautery is relieved.
E lahoras pausa un dels emplastres confortantz e exsitans, e strenh sobre aquel am liament; e comanda al malaute que use de repaus e de tranquillitat e que no dorme sobre la partida am la qual atroba dolor entro que sia sanat.	And then place a comforting and effective bandage, tighten it around that area; and order the patient to rest and maintain tranquility, and not sleep on the side where they feel pain until it is healed.
E si accideys deves la atricio del os satagias o alcuna causa que ja es seperada de lu, lahoras cove que secces sobre la codena e que ostes aquel os; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua, am sutura si es gran; e aprop cura aquela am alcu encarnatiu dels enguentz, entro que sia sanat.	If a fracture of the leg bone or any other cause already separated from it occurs, you must cover it with a dry dressing and support that bone; and then adjust the two edges of the wound, either by suturing if it is large; and treat it with care to avoid inflammation of the wound, as long as it heals.
Mays si es trencat le derier del os alhoses, e es la fi de la coeta, lahoras cove que tu entrometas le dit pous de la ma senestra en le cul, e que enguales le os trencat am l’autra ma segon que es possible per equacio segonda; e aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e astelha, si indigeysses de aquels, e aprop strenh aquel.	If the last part of the leg bone is broken and it is the end of the limb, you must then insert your left hand's thumb into the gap between the broken bones and bite down on the broken bone with your other hand as gently as possible; then apply a plaster and bandage over it if needed, and tighten it securely.
E si sentes satagias trencadas en lu, lahoras tu fen sobre aquela, e osta aquel, e cura la plagua am la curacio que es precedida entro que sia sanada.	And if you feel bones broken within it, then bind them securely and support that area, and treat the wound with the appropriate treatment until it heals.
Capitol .x.	**Chapter X.**
De restauracio de la ancha.	On the restoration of the wide [or perhaps: open].
Les osses de las anchas tart so trencats, e si trencan, lahoras la fractura de lor no es sino communicio en las extremitatz de aquelas e son inscidas en la longitut e declinan a las partidas dedintz; e accideys al malaute dolor en le loc e punctura, e la camba es stupefacta quan es fractura.	The bones of the thighs are often broken, and when they break, the fracture is nothing but communication in the extremities of those parts and are sharp at the ends and decline inward; and it causes pain to the patient at the site and piercing, and the limb is stunned when a fracture occurs.
E la restauracio de lu es que tu extendas la tua ma sobre aquel entro que sia sobre la fractura qual es la figura de lu.	And the restoration of it is that you place your hand over that area which is above the fracture, as the figure of it.
E si fractura es en la extremitat de lu tant solament, lahoras tu enguala aquela segon que a tu es apparelhat per equacio engual entro que sia asemblat a la sua figura natural.	And if the fracture is at the extremity of it, then you should wrap that according to what you have been taught by equal experience, just as it is assembled to its natural shape.
Mays si la fractura es en le lonc o que ja declina a las partidas dejos, lahoras tu fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu ventre entro que sia preparada a tu la restauracio de aquela fractura.	If the fracture is in the long bone or that it already declines inward towards the parts, then you should make the patient lie on their stomach, so that you can prepare for the restoration of that fracture.
E donc quan auras engualada aquela, pausa sobre lu emplastre, e aprop pausa sobre aquel astela de fust o de codena, e strenh per strictura sobre la qual no temas punctacio de fractura ni remocio de la stelha.	And so when you have enveloped it, apply the plaster and then place a strip of wood or canvas over it, tightening firmly without fear of fracture or removal of the stitch.
E enguala la concavitat am aquo que uempla aquela entro que aquela prengua la strictura segon equalitat, e comanda al malaute que dorma sobre le sieu dos o desobre le sieu costat sa.	And envelop the concavity with something that fills it equally as it takes on the stricture, and instruct the patient to sleep on their back or side.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras tu cessa de extencio de lu e de la sua restauracio entro que sia sedat le apostema caut, e pausa sobre lu aquo que sede aquel segon que es precedit; e aprop retorna a la restauracio de lu, e strenh aquel ayssi cum cove.	If an abscess occurs cautiously, stop the extension of it and its restoration until the abscess cauterization is sedated, and apply over it what was previously mentioned; then return to the restoration of it, and tighten that thus with a cover.
E si accideysso en le os satagias o son comminuidas, lahoras tu las tratz.	And if it happens in the bones or they are broken, then you treat them.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI.
De restauracio de la fractura del adjutori.	On the restoration of the fracture of the assistant (or, possibly, 'helper').
Adjutori es aquo que es entre le coyde entro al cap de la spalla.	The adjutori is what is between the thigh and the head of the shoulder.
E si es trencat, lahoras la restauracio de lu es en una de doas manieyras, de las quals es la una que tu prenguas fust pla de migiera groceza segon aquesta forma:	And if it is fractured, the restoration of it is in one of two ways, of which one is to take a plane of moderate roughness as follows:
E sian liatz en doas extremitatz dos liamentz, e aprop sia suspendut del loc elevat.	And both ends of the ligament are seen, and then it is suspended from an elevated position.
E segua le malaute sobre una sezela; e aprop gieta fora le sieu bras trencat sobre le fust entro que pervengua al titillic de lu en le mieg loc del qual sia annexa la curvitat del fust.	Then attend to the patient on one side; and subsequently, cast out his broken arm over a splint until it reaches the thickest part of the bone where the curvature of the bone is attached.
E aprop suspen sobre aquel alcuna causa greu, o·l minestre extenda aquel a las partidas dejos; e aprop le metge eque la fractura am las sieuas mas ensemps, entro que la fractura retorne segon que cove.	And subsequently, it is suspended over some heavy cause, or the doctor extends it to the parts below; and then the surgeon places his hands on the fracture, until it returns as it should.
E l’autra manieyra es que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sieua cervitz e suspen la ma del col de lu am liament; e aprop comanda a dos ministres que la un de lor tengua aquo que es desobre la fractura am las suas mas; e l’autre tengua le pus dejos de lu; e quascu de lor extenda a la sua partida.	And another method is to have the patient lie on their back and raise their head with their hands; then command two ministers: one of them holds what is above the fracture with his hands, and the other collects the pus from below; each of them extends themselves accordingly.
E si voles que la extencio sia pus fort, lahoras tu strenh sobre la fractura am liament e sobre aquela am autre liament, e quascu dels dos ministres extendan a doas suas partidas.	If you wish to increase the extent of the traction, then tighten it over the fracture with ligatures and over another ligament; each of the two ministers extends themselves in two directions.
E donc si la fractura es propinquada a la extremitat del muscle, lahoras cove que sia pausat la mitat del liament sobre le citillic e l’autre dejos la fractura deves le coyde.	And therefore, if the fracture is close to the extremity of the muscle, you should place the middle of the ligature on the tendon and leave the other end behind the fracture towards the elbow.
E semblantment si la fractura es propdana al coyde, lahoras cove que sia pausat le liament sobre aquel loc e sobre aquel coyde.	And similarly, if the fracture is near the elbow, you should place the ligature at that point and over the elbow.
Enguala aquela am facilitat e ses trebal, e aprop quant sira engualada segon que cove e es applicada per bona applicacio, lahoras strenh aquela si no accideys apostema caut.	Immerse that in easy water and facilitate the work, and then, when it is soaked according to its nature and applied properly, tighten it carefully if blistering does not occur.
Mays si accideys apostema caut, lahoras layssa la strictura entro al vii dia, e pausa sobre lu lana sutza enbeguda en vi agre e oli rozat entro que repause le apostema, e lahoras tu stren aquela.	If blistering does occur, loosen the tightness after the seventh day and place a cloth dipped in vinegar and rose oil over it to soothe the abscess, and then tighten it again.
E la manieyra de strenher aquela es que pauses emplastre sobre la fractura, e aprop pausa envolopament de drap nau sobre le emplastre; e aprop ajuste le bras sobre aquel adjutori, e pause la sua ma uberta sobre le sieu muscle.	The method of tightening is to place a plaster over the fracture, then wrap it with clean cloth, adjust the arm upon the support, and hold your hand open over its muscle.
E pausa le drap e strenh sobre le adjutori le bras per so que·l bras sia en loc de stelhas, si no prohibeys de aquo alcuna causa del os trencat.	And unfold the cloth and tighten upon the arm support to keep the arm in place, unless some other cause prevents it from moving.
E lahoras usa de stelhas.	And then use splints.
E es que pauses sobre la fractura aquela stela que sia pus lada e pus fort de las autras stelas; e pausa entre quascuna stela la latitut del dit, e sia la longitut de las stelas segon la trencadura am addicio de tres ditz de tota partida.	And it is that it rests on the fracture that steel which is placed and firm among the other steels; it rests between each steel the width of the finger, and its length according to the break plus three parts from the whole.
E aprop strenh sobre las stelas am la strictura la qual he dita al comensament del capitol.	And then tighten the steels with the strapping mentioned at the beginning of this chapter.
E es que la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura sia pus streyt.	And it is that the strapping on the place of the fracture should be tighter.
E quant pus es alonguada la fractura sia la strictura menor.	And the further away from each other the fracture is, the less the strapping should be.
E donc si vezes le situament de las stelas e la strictura ayssi cum havem dit en la hora en la qual restauras le membre al sieu assituament, lahoras tu fay.	And therefore, depending on the position of the steels and the strapping as we have said in the time when you restore the member to its position, so do you act.
E si temes apostema caut, lahoras tu layssa la strictura e las stelas entro al dia vii ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you fear gangrene, leave off the tightness and take away the bandages on the seventh day as we have said.
E aprop considera le liament en totas partidas per tres dias per so que no accida en le loc pruziment o imflacio; o es prohibida la vianda pervenir al membre per disposicio de superfluitat de strictura; e donc rectifiqua tot aquo segon que havem dit.	And thereafter, consider the dressing on all wounds for three days to prevent any further damage or inflammation; it is forbidden to eat foods that reach the member due to excessive tightness; and thus, rectify everything as we have said.
Mays si tu yest sobre confizanssa que no accida alcuna causa de aquo, lahoras no deslias la liguadura sino aprop tres dias o mays.	If you are certain that nothing further will occur from it, do not loosen the ligature but instead wait for three days or more.
E sia la sua dormicio del malaute sobre le sieu dos, e las sieuas mas sian sobre le stomac.	And the patient's rest should be on their back, and their hands over their stomach.
E pausa sobre le adjutori cocena plena de lana engualment, e considera en tota hora de la nueyt o del dia que no sia deliada ni dissolta la figura del membre trencat, o que sia le liament mollificat, donc rectifica aquo tot am la tua vertut.	And place a warm, woolen compress over the injured member, and consider at all times during night or day that the bandage not be loosened or dissolved, or the dressing become soft; thus, rectify it entirely with your skill.
E pausa la vianda del malaute segon le orde le qual havem denant mes, enayssi que la vianda sia subtil en le comensament entro que es comensat strenher; e lahoras cove que egrossas la vianda de lu.	And hold the patient's food according to the order we have mentioned before, so that the food is delicate at first until it begins to tighten; and now you will notice that the food becomes thicker in them.
Quar de constuma del adjutori e de la camba de lu es que sian strengutz en xl dias; e lahoras cove que sian desliatz e sia administrat banh e sia medicat am enguentz los quals rectifican aquel.	The custom of the assistant and the leg support is to tighten them in 40 days, and you will notice that they loosen and should be bathed and treated with ointments that rectify this condition.
E si la fractura es layha atrita, lahoras tu no deslies de aquela le liament e las stelhas entro a l dias o entro a dos meses.	And if the fracture is slight and fresh, you will not loosen the bandage and splints for one to two months.
Capitol .xii.	**Chapter XII**
De restauracio de fractura del bras.	**On the Restoration of Broken Arms**
Bras es compost de dos osses les quals so appelatz dos focils; dels quals la un es petit, e es aquel que siec le dit pous, e l’autre es gran e es aquel le qual es pausat dejos le petit dit, de la partida pus dejus.	The arm is composed of two bones, which are called the humerus and the radius; of these, one is smaller, and is said to be the elbow bone, while the other is larger and is placed below the small bone, extending upward.
E fort leu es trencat le focil major solament, o le petit, e fort leu son trincatz ensemps.	And if the main or secondary fissure is only slightly broken, or both at once, they are seldom torn completely.
E quan es trencat le focil petit desus, lahoras la restauracio de lu es leugiera, e la sanacio de lu es pus leugiera.	And when the small fissure above is broken, its restoration is easy, and its healing is even easier.
E quan es trencat le focil de lu dejos la fractura de lu es mala, e la sanacio de lu es dificil.	And when the fissure of it below is broken, its fracture is severe, and its healing is difficult.
E pus mala de aquela es quan son trencatz dos osses essemps.	And worse is when two bones are broken at the same time.
Donc si l’os le qual es trencat es le focil petit desus, lahoras es convenient al metge, deves la restauracio de lu, que pauze petita extencio am facilitat entro que aquel sia engualhat.	Therefore, if the bone that is broken is the small fissure above, it is advantageous for the doctor, as its restoration should be easy, allowing for a quick recovery before it becomes engorged.
Mays si le focil gran es aquo que es trincat, lahoras cove que pause extencio pus vehement.	If the large fissure is what is broken, then it must be handled with more urgency as its extension becomes more violent.
E si les dos focils so ensemps trincatz, lahoras cove que tu pauses la extritura mot pus fort.	And if the two incisions are simultaneously lacerated, then be sure to press the most powerful extraction.
E cove que pauses la figura de la ma deves la restauracio de lu e la extencio de lu estenduda sobre un coyssi, e sia le pols de la ma a las partidas desus, pus aut que totz les autres ditz, e le dit auricular sia pus bas dels autres ditz, e le malaute sia cezent sobre una cezela cayrada.	And be sure to place your hand in the position of restoration and extension over one cushion, with the wrist of your hand parted from it, more so than all other positions, and the tactile sense of your ear should be lower than all other senses, and the patient should be centring on a comfortable bed.
E sia un coyssi denant lu en la altetut o endreyt de lu, per so que·l malaute no encorra trebalh.	And place a cushion before them at an elevated or upright position, so that the patient does not have to exert themselves.
E aprop le ministre extenda le bras de la partida pus dejos am la sieua ma o am liament, e autre ministre extenda desus semblantment.	Then the assistant should extend their arm fully on one side with their hand free or tied, and another assistant extends theirs similarly above.
E aprop le metge engualhe le os entro que redugua aquel segon la milhor figura que pot.	Then the doctor should align the bone within as it reduces according to the best position possible.
E si en la factura del os so satagias, lahoras te perforsa raduzir tota pessa en le sieu loc am la tua vertut.	And if in the treatment of the bone there are obstacles, you must reduce all the pain to its place using your virtue.
E si appar en lu satagia separada que punh la codena e no es a tu speransa en la restauracio de lu, lahoras tu fen sobre lu e osta aquela segon la manieyra la qual havem dita desus.	And if there appears to be a separate problem that threatens the cord and does not seem hopeful for restoration, then you must perform an operation on it and preserve it according to the method we have described above.
Mays si la fractura es am plagua, yeu ja he fayt ad aquo capitol singular, e donc pren la curacio de aquel.	If the fracture is severe, you have already reached this particular chapter, and therefore take care of that one.
E si accideys apostema caut al comensament de la tua restauracio, lahoras tu lineys un drap am cerot fayt de oli rozat e cera blanca, e sia migier entre specitut e subtilitat, e strenh drap sobre aquel am strictura subtil entro que le apostema sia cedat; e lahoras remau le cerot e pausa emplastre preparat de polvera de moli am clayre de huou, e aprop pausa stelhas; e sia la stela la qual es pauzada sobre aquela fractura pus lada e pus fort.	And if an abscess occurs at the beginning of your restoration, you must line it with a cloth made of olive oil and white wax, with greater care between caution and subtlety, and tighten the cloth over that slight gap until the abscess yields; then remove the bandage and apply a plaster prepared from powdered chalk, and place stars; and let the star be placed on that fracture both more and more firmly.
E sapias que·l nombre de las stelas del bras so vi en las majors disposicios, o sia la fractura en un focil o en dos focils ensemps.	And you should know that the names of the bones in the arm are visible in their proper arrangements, either in one fracture or in two fragments at the same time.
E aprop pausa la tua strictura sobre le loc de la fractura pus fort e pus vehement, e quan mays sira la extrictura a las partidas desus de la fractura o a las partidas pus bassas de lu, pausa la strictura un pauc pus molh segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu en le comensament del capitol.	Then apply your pressure over the site of the fracture with greater force and intensity, and as the tightness around the fragments above or below the fracture increases, reduce the pressure slightly according to how much pain the patient experiences at the beginning of the chapter.
E les draps que so envolopatz sobre la fractura sian draps mols humitz, e no sian durs ni aspres, e·l fiel am le qual es strenhut sia de li propriament migier entre subtil e gros, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And the bandages that are wrapped around the fracture should be soft and moist, not hard or rough, and the thread used to secure them should be medium in thickness, as we have recommended.
E considera le membre e·l liament aprop alcus dias.	And consider the member and its ligament over several days.
E si accideys alcuna causa de la qual rectificacio es necessaria, ayssi cum prusiment le qual accideys al membre, e lahoras cove que tu enbroques le membre am aygua cauda entro que cesse aquel pruziment.	And if any cause arises that requires correction, as soon as you notice a problem with the member, you should apply cold water to it until the pain subsides.
E leysses le membre no costreyt entro que repause, e aprop torna la strictura.	And allow the member to relax until it rests, then return the tightness.
E si la extrictura ja es mollificada e l’os ja es remaugut e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras rectifiqua tot aquo am la tua vertut.	And if the tightness is already relaxed and the bones have healed and resemble those before, then correct everything with your virtue.
E considera mays si le nutriment es prohibit pervenir al membre per superfluitat de strictura, quar lahoras cove que mollifiques aquel un petit e laysses aquel per alcus dias entro que corra ad aquel le nutriment, e aprop strenh aquel.	And consider whether the nourishment is prevented from reaching the member due to excessive tightness, for then you must soften that slightly and allow it a few days until the nourishment reaches it, and then strengthen it.
Mays si al malaute no accideys alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no cove que sia desliat entro aprop xx dias o enviro de aquels.	If the patient does not experience any of the causes we have mentioned, then it is not necessary to loosen it within a few days or around those times.
E aprop sia suspenduda la ma del malaute per la sua vertut de movement agitatius, e fay aquel dormir sobre le sieu dos.	And hold the patient's hand with the power of their virtue to prevent excessive movement, and make them sleep on their back.
E sapias que aquesta fractura es restaurada en xxx dias o en xxxii dias, o fort leu es restaurada en xxviii dias, e tot aquo es segon la disposicio de las compleccios e las disposicios de la vertut.	And you know that this fracture is restored in XXX days or in XXXII days, or quickly restored in 28 days, and all of this depends on the condition of the complications and the disposition of virtue.
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII
De restauracio de fractura de la pinche de la ma e dels ditz.	On the restoration of fractures of the spine and ribs.
Sapias que a la pinche de la ma e als nuzes dels ditz tart endeve fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio motas veguadas.	You know that in the spine and ribs, fractures often occur along with dislocation, and these do not heal properly unless the movement is reduced.
E quan accideys a la ma fractura o atrissio, lahoras cove que·l malaute segua cayrat e denant lu lies cezent segon equalitat, e aprop pausa la ma de lu sobre aquela extenduda.	And when there is a fracture or dislocation of the spine, you will find that the patient's condition worsens and lies in pain, and then support the spine over the affected area.
E aprop le ministre extenda les osses trencatz e·l metge engualhe aquels entro que sian congongitz am bona congoncio.	And the physician should extend the broken bones and align them in a proper position.
E lahoras cove que pause emplastre e estopa, si no accideys apostema caut; e aprop pausa stela desus segon la quantitat del loc, e tu ja has envolopada aquela en drap de li.	And then cover it with a plaster and stoppers, if you do not want to risk gangrene; and place the bandage from above according to the extent of the wound, and you have already wrapped it in linen cloth.
Mays si la trincadura es en las partidas dedintz deves le ventre de la palma, e lahoras fay semblant de spera de drap, e comanda al malaute que strenha aquela am la sua palma trincada; aprop sia strenguda am drap lonc.	If the fracture is in the joints of the hand, and it appears like a thread of cloth, and you make the patient press on that fractured joint, then wrap a long strip of cloth around it tightly.
E sia la stelha de cuer am drap en le qual sia levitat, per so que le cuer sia aplicat a la palma; e strenh aquela segon que cove.	And the bandage of cloth should be in such a way that it supports the body, so that the hand is aligned with the palm; and tighten it according to need.
Mays si la fractura es a las partidas defora, lahoras cove que pauses desus stela e autre estela de la partida dejos en la palma, per so que la ma sia uberta e dreyta; e aprop pausa la strictura, ayssi cum es revolvuda la ma a la rateta entre les ditz am liamentz.	If the fracture is in the exterior parts, then you should place a bandage on it and another bandage on the side left in the palm, so that the hand is covered and straightened; and tighten it, as the hand is rotated to its natural position between the joints.
E si accideys fractura a alcu dels nozes dels ditz, lahoras si es le dit pous, sia engualat segon que cove e aprop sia strenhut am la palma e si·t voles, pausa a lu astela petita dreyta per so que sia elevada la fractura e no sia mauguda.	If a fracture occurs in one of the joints of the fingers, if it is the thumb, it should be immobilized according to its position and then tightly bound with the palm turned slightly upwards, if desired, using a small right splint to elevate the fracture and prevent further damage.
Mays si la fractura es en les autres ditz, ayssi cum en aquel del mieg loc, o en le indic, o en le auricular, o en le anular, lahoras sia engualhat e liat am le dit sa le qual siec aquel; o sian totz liatz segon continuacio, e es milhor; o pausa sobre aquel stela petita, ayssi cum havem dit en le pous.	If the fracture is in other joints of the hand, just as in the middle finger, or index, or little finger, it should be immobilized with a splint on the affected digit; or all fingers can be bound together in sequence, which is better; or a small splint can be placed over it, as we have said for the thumb.
E considera, en la tua restauracio, e aprop aquela, la disposicio de apostema caut e oppose — am la tieua operacio — am aquo que cove quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, segon que es iterada la narracio de lu.	And consider, in your restoration, the order of setting bones and opposing them - with great caution during your operation - regarding what covers when any cause of those occurs, as described iteratively.
Capitol .xiv.	Chapter XIV.
De restauracio de fractura del os de la coyssa.	On the restoration of the broken bone in the thigh.
Le os de la cueyssa motas veguadas es trencat e es declarat al sentiment segon que es convertit a la partida denant e a la pus sobirana.	The bone in the thigh moves and breaks, presenting itself in the form of swelling according to its position and the pus that forms around it.
E la restauracio de lu se fa enayssi que·l liament es strenhut sobre la fractura e autre liament dejos la fractura, e le malaute sia prostrat sobre le sieu ventre e sobre la cara.	And the restoration of it is done thus: the ligament is tightened over the fracture and another ligament is placed around the fracture, and the patient is laid on their stomach and face down.
E aprop le ministre extenda tot le liament a la sua partida segon la qualitat, quan la fractura es en le mieg loc del os.	Then the physician extends the ligament to its full length according to its quality, when the fracture is in the middle part of the bone.
Mays si es propdana a la razitz de la cueyssa, lahoras sia le liament propda al denolh a la partida del pentenilh, per so que la extencio caja en sus, e le autre liament dejos la fractura.	If it is indicated to operate on the thigh, then the ligament should be tightened from the opposite side towards the knee joint, allowing for its extension, and another ligament placed around the fracture.
E semblantment si la trencadura es propdana al denolh, lahoras sia fayt le liament propda al denol, e sia la extencio a las partidas dejos.	And if the fracture seems to be deeply embedded, then make the ligament proper to the joint, and extend it to the detached parts.
E aprop le metge enguale le os am amduas las sieuas mas entro que reduzesca aquel segon la semblansa natural e l’os es conjungit per bona conjunccio; lahoras cove que pauses emplastre e strictura, si no accideys al membre apostema.	Then the doctor should align the bones with both hands, reducing them according to their natural appearance, and the bone is joined by a good joint; then it is necessary to cover with plaster and tension, so as not to cause necrosis of the member.
Mays si accideys en lu apostema, lahoras tu layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que l’apostema caut sia cedat, e aprop retorna a la tua curacio.	If necrosis occurs in the member, then leave it for a few days until the infection has subsided, and then return to your treatment.
La strictura de lu sia ayssi fayta: cove que envolopes sobre la fractura una benda dura, e dobla aquela dos o tres veguadas, e remaugua de lu superfluitat; e aprop envolopa la camba entro que pervengua al talo e a la razitz de la cueyssa.	The tension should be done thus: it is necessary to wrap around the fracture a hard bandage, folding it two or three times, and removing the excess; then wrap the leg until it reaches the thigh and the root of the limb.
E intromet lonc fiel entre la cueyssa e la camba prop del denol a las partidas dejos, e venguan las extremitatz del fiel de la partida pus sobirana de las doas partz, e aprop revolveys sobre la camba e la cueyssa aquo que superflueys de la benda.	And insert a long strip of cloth between the thigh and leg close to the joint, bringing the ends of the cloth from the sides of the joint, making them superior to both parts, and then turn over the leg and thigh what is superfluous of the bandage.
E aprop pausa sobre la cueyssa en le loc de aquela fractura astelhas, e pausa de aquelas una stela sobre le os de la camba.	And then place your hand over the thigh at the site of that fracture as well, and place one stick on the bone of the leg.
E aprop uempli las vacuitatz entre la camba e la cuoyssa am draps mols, per so que sia coagulada la extrictura.	And then fill the vacuum between the thigh and leg with soft drapes, so that the constriction is coagulated.
E aprop comensa am strictura fort del mieg sobre le loc de la fractura am tres envolucios o quatre, e quant mays tu te alonhas am liament del loc de la fractura, la tua strictura sia menor e pus leugiera e pus molha.	And then commence with a strong constriction of the middle layer over the site of the fracture using three or four folds, and as you distance yourself more from the site of the fracture, your constriction should be weaker and lighter and wetter.
E aprop exten a doas extremitatz del fiel a las partidas dejos entro que pervengua a la cavilha del pe, e strenh amdoas las extremitatz de las stelhas del autra part per so que·l liament no sia remaugut del sieu loc.	And then extend the two ends of the cloth to the sides until they reach the foot's ankle, and tighten both ends of the sticks from the other part so that the bandage does not move from its place.
E aprop leyssa la strectura sobre aquel, don esta ayssi que no accideys al membre corrosio ni apostema caut ni emflacio e semblantz ad aquels; e si accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, adonc cueta te am desliament de lu, e rectifica aquo que accideys tot aprop, segon que havem dit motas veguadas.	And then apply the compression over it in such a way that it does not cause damage or gangrene or inflammation and similar conditions; and if any cause of those arises, then it is necessary to remove it from you, and correct what happens immediately, as we have mentioned previously.
Mays si en le os es pessa del os la qual pongua, lahoras cove que tu engualhes aquel segon que a tu es possibla; e sino, fen sobre lu e remau aquel, e cura am aquo del qual es precedida la rememoracio entro que sia sanat.	If there is pain in the bone itself, then cover it with what you can obtain; if not, wrap it and remove the cause, and treat that from which the memory of the pain arises until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es strenhuda aquesta fractura de la coyssa otra aquo que sian ajustadas a lu stelhas, ayssi cum havem dit en le adjutori e·n le bras.	And in some cases, this fracture of the thigh is so severe that it cannot be adjusted with the help of bandages, as we have mentioned regarding the aid and treatment of the arm.
Mays empero en la restauracio de lu en tal manieyra fayta no accideys al malaute claudicacio; e si es restaurada sola, otra aquo que li sia applicada l’autra camba, lahoras es necessari que claudique aquel del qual es tostemps.	However, in the restoration of it in such a manner, one should not cause the patient's disability; and if it is restored alone, then another method should be applied to the other leg, because it is necessary that the disabled leg become strong again.
E sapias que la coyssa es strenhuda en xl dias o un pauc mes o un pauc mens, e tot aquo es segon la diversitat de las compleccios e de las autras dispozicios.	And you should know that the condition is severe in 40 days or a little more or a little less, and all of this depends on the variety of complications and other dispositions.
Capitol .xv.	**Chapter XV**
De restauracio de la fractura de la rodela del denolh.	**On the Restoration of the Broken Rib of the Right Side**
Sapias que fractura de la rodela del denol tart endeve, mays accideys a lu motas veguadas atrissio.	You should know that the fracture of the rib on the right side often ends in lasting pain, frequently resulting from inflammation and stiffness.

Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De restauracio de la fractura de la camba.	On the Restoration of the Broken Leg.
Sapias que en la camba so dos osses dels quals la un es gros, e es le nompnat per nom de la camba; e l’autra es subtil, e es nompnat focil.	Know that in the leg there are two bones, of which one is thick and is called the femur; and the other is thin and is called the tibia.
E accideys a quascus de las specias de fractura aquo que accideys als dos osses del bras, e per aquo es fayta restauracio de lu ayssi cum restauracio del bras engualment, e la operacio de lu es una. E si so trincatz dos osses ensemps, la camba es convertida a totas partidas.	If two bones are broken together, the leg is completely shattered.
E si es trinquat le os pus subtil, la camba es convertida a las partidas Denant.	And if the bone is broken with a subtle crack, the leg is shattered in several places.
E si es trincat le os pus gros, atrobas aquel dejos, e es de aquelas causas que no so a tu ameguadas.	And if the bone is broken with a severe crack, it leaves a mark, and it's one of those causes that are not easily healed.

E en la camba es alcuna causa de operacio sobre le bras, e es quan tu engualas las stelhas e que comples tota la tieua operacio, lahoras tu prendras pessas de fustz de pi le qual es pausat dejos las cauzas las quals so pausades en solies, e so faytas eyssament de brancas de palma; aligeys de aquelas a las quals es petita groceza, e no sia ges de las manudas, e sia la longuesa de aquelas segon la longuesa de la camba, e del denol entro al pus dejos.	In the leg, there is also a cause for surgery on the arm, and when you stitch the stitches and complete the entire surgical procedure, you will take wooden splints from which the causes are removed, which are placed in places where they are left alone, and are made entirely of palm leaves; tie those to the ones that require small roughness, and be careful not to interfere with the hands, and the length of those should be according to the length of the leg, and from the inner part to the outer part.
E aprop envolopa sobre quascuna drap en doas envolucios segon la longitut de lu, e pausa la una sobre la partida de la camba de la una part e l’autra del autra part, e sian del denol entro al pus bas loc del pe.	And then wrap each drape in two layers according to its length, placing one over the leg's joint from one side and the other from the other side, ensuring they are tightly wrapped around the foot's base.
E aprop lias las doas stelhas en tres locs de doas extremitatz e al mieg loc, quar am aquesta strectura la camba es prohibida de clinar a la partida dextra e sinistra, e sta per bona stacio.	Then attach the two splints at three points on each extremity and in the middle, as this structure prevents the leg from bending at the joints, keeping it in a stable position.
E ja es aministrat un brasset de fust segon la longuesa de la camba; e sia pausada en lu la camba per so que conserve aquel de movement.	And now a splint of wood should be applied according to the length of the leg, holding it in place so that it remains still and does not move.
E majorment cove que tu fassas aquo en fractura, e quan am aquela es plagua propriament.	Especially ensure that this is done in the case of a fracture, and when it is truly painful.
E aprop considera en quascun jorn la camba e studia am aquel per derier studi, e tu le guardes de apostema e de imflacio o de autres causas semblantz; e cum accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, lahoras opausa te a lu am aquo que cove entro que sia sanat.	And then consider the leg daily, examining it closely and studying its condition through further observation; and you should keep an eye on it for any signs of separation or inflammation or other similar causes. And when any such cause arises, be prepared to treat it as necessary until healing occurs.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De la fractura del talo e dels osses del pe e dels ditz.	On the fracture of the talus bone and the bones of the foot, and on their treatment.
Al talo no accideys fractura de tot; mays als osses del pe accideys fractura alcunas veguadas; e als ditz del pe pauc accideys fractura, e no accideys a lor sino atricio en las mes de disposicio.	The talus bone does not suffer a fracture entirely; rather, it is the bones of the foot that sometimes experience fractures; and the joints of the foot rarely suffer fractures but instead undergo deterioration due to poor condition.
E si als osses del pe endeve fractura e vezes aquels osses esser elevatz sobre si entre lor, lahoras le malaute pause le sieu pe sobre la terra preparat ayssi cum anant.
